   38: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0, init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   39:          init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2,

   46:          shell_history_corrupt/1,

   48:          shell_history_toggle/1,
   49: 	 job_control_remote_noshell/1,ctrl_keys/1,
   50:          get_columns_and_rows_escript/1,

   74: %% Exports for custom shell history module
   75: -export([load/0, add/1]).
   76: %% For custom prompt testing
   77: -export([prompt/1]).
   78: -record(tmux, {peer, node, name, orig_location }).
   79: suite() ->
   80:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   81:      {timetrap,{minutes,3}}].
   82: 
   83: all() ->
   84:     [{group, to_erl},
   85:      {group, tty}].
   86: 
   87: groups() ->
   88:     [{to_erl,[],
   89:       [get_columns_and_rows_escript,get_columns_and_rows,
   90:        exit_initial, job_control_local,
   91:        job_control_remote, job_control_remote_noshell,
   92:        ctrl_keys, stop_during_init, wrap,
   93:        shell_invalid_ansi,
   94:        shell_get_password,
   95:        noshell_raw,
   96:        {group, shell_history},
   97:        {group, remsh}]},
   98:      {shell_history, [],
   99:       [shell_history,
  100:        shell_history_resize,
  101:        shell_history_eaccess,
  102:        shell_history_repair,
  103:        shell_history_repair_corrupt,
  104:        shell_history_corrupt,
  105:        shell_history_toggle,
  106:        {group, sh_custom}
  107:       ]},
  108:      {sh_custom, [],
  109:       [shell_history_custom,
  110:        shell_history_custom_errors]},
  111:      {remsh, [],
  112:       [remsh_basic,
  113:        remsh_error,
  114:        remsh_longnames,
  115:        remsh_no_epmd,
  116:        remsh_expand_compatibility_25,
  117:        remsh_expand_compatibility_later_version]},
  118:      {tty,[],
  119:       [{group,tty_unicode},
  120:        {group,tty_latin1},
  121:        test_invalid_keymap, test_valid_keymap,
  122:        shell_suspend,
  123:        shell_full_queue,
  124:        external_editor,
  125:        external_editor_visual,
  126:        shell_ignore_pager_commands,
  127:        shell_help
  128:       ]},
  129:      {tty_unicode,[parallel],
  130:       [{group,tty_tests},
  131:        shell_invalid_unicode,
  132:        external_editor_unicode
  133:        %% unicode wrapping does not work right yet
  134:        %% shell_unicode_wrap,
  135:        %% shell_delete_unicode_wrap,
  136:        %% shell_delete_unicode_not_at_cursor_wrap,
  137:        %% shell_update_window_unicode_wrap
  138:       ]},
  139:      {tty_latin1,[],[{group,tty_tests}]},
  140:      {tty_tests, [parallel],
  141:       [shell_navigation, shell_multiline_navigation, shell_multiline_prompt,
  142:        shell_xnfix, shell_delete, shell_format,
  143:        shell_transpose, shell_search, shell_insert,

  151:     ].
  152: 
  153: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  154:     Term = os:getenv("TERM", "dumb"),
  155:     os:putenv("TERM", "vt100"),
  156:     [{term,Term}|Config].
  157: 
  158: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  159:     Term = proplists:get_value(term,Config),
  160:     os:putenv("TERM",Term),
  161:     ok.
  162: 
  163: init_per_group(to_erl, Config) ->
  164:     case rtnode:get_progs() of
  165:         {error, Error} ->
  166:             {skip, Error};
  167:         _ ->
  168:             DefShell = rtnode:get_default_shell(),
  169:             [{default_shell,DefShell}|Config]
  170:     end;
  171: init_per_group(remsh, Config) ->
  172:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
  173:         old -> {skip, "Not supported in old shell"};
  174:         new -> Config
  175:     end;
  176: init_per_group(shell_history, Config) ->
  177:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
  178:         old -> {skip, "Not supported in old shell"};
  179:         new -> Config
  180:     end;
  181: init_per_group(tty, Config) ->
  182:     case string:split(tmux("-V")," ") of
  183:         ["tmux",[Num,$.|_]] when Num >= $3, Num =< $9 ->
  184:             tmux("kill-session"),
  185:             "" = tmux("-u new-session -x 50 -y 60 -d"),
  186:             ["" = tmux(["set-environment '",Name,"' '",Value,"'"])
  187:              || {Name,Value} <- os:env()],
  188:             Config;
  189:         ["tmux", Vsn] ->
  190:             {skip, "invalid tmux version " ++ Vsn ++ ". Need vsn 3 or later"};
  191:         Error ->
  192:             {skip, "tmux not installed " ++ Error}
  193:     end;
  194: init_per_group(Group, Config) when Group =:= tty_unicode;
  195:                                    Group =:= tty_latin1 ->
  196:     [Lang,_] =
  197:         string:split(
  198:           os:getenv("LC_ALL",
  199:                     os:getenv("LC_CTYPE",
  200:                               os:getenv("LANG","en_US.UTF-8"))),"."),
  201:     case Group of
  202:         tty_unicode ->
  203:             [{encoding, unicode},{env,[{"LC_ALL",Lang++".UTF-8"}]}|Config];
  204:         tty_latin1 ->
  205:             % [{encoding, latin1},{env,[{"LC_ALL",Lang++".ISO-8859-1"}]}|Config],
  206:             {skip, "latin1 tests not implemented yet"}
  207:     end;
  208: init_per_group(sh_custom, Config) ->
  209:     %% Ensure that ERL_AFLAGS will not override the value of the shell_history variable.
  210:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-noshell","-kernel","shell_history","not_overridden"]),
  211:     try erpc:call(Node, application, get_env, [kernel, shell_history], rtnode:timeout(normal)) of
  212:         {ok, not_overridden} ->
  213:             Config;
  214:         _ ->
  215:             SkipText = "shell_history variable is overridden (probably by ERL_AFLAGS)",
  216:             {skip, SkipText}
  217:     catch
  218:         C:R:Stk ->
  219:             io:format("~p\n~p\n~p\n", [C,R,Stk]),
  220:             {skip, "Unexpected error"}
  221:     after
  222:         peer:stop(Peer)
  223:     end;
  224: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  225:     Config.
  226: 
  227: end_per_group(tty, _Config) ->
  228:     Windows = string:split(tmux("list-windows"), "\n", all),
  229:     lists:foreach(
  230:       fun(W) ->
  231:               case string:split(W, " ", all) of
  232:                   ["0:" | _] -> ok;
  233:                   [No, _Name | _] ->
  234:                       "" = os:cmd(["tmux select-window -t ", string:split(No,":")]),
  235:                       ct:log("~ts~n~ts",[W, os:cmd(lists:concat(["tmux capture-pane -p -e"]))])
  236:               end
  237:       end, Windows),
  238: %    "" = os:cmd("tmux kill-session")
  239:     ok;
  240: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  241:     Config.
  242: 
  243: init_per_testcase(Func, Config) ->
  244:     Path = [Func,
  245:             [proplists:get_value(name,P) ||
  246:                 P <- [proplists:get_value(tc_group_properties,Config,[])] ++
  247:                     proplists:get_value(tc_group_path,Config,[])]],
  248:     [{tc_path, lists:concat(lists:join("-",lists:flatten(Path)))} | Config].
  249: 
  250: end_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
  251:     GroupProperties = proplists:get_value(tc_group_properties, Config),
  252:     case (GroupProperties =/= false) andalso proplists:get_value(parallel, GroupProperties, false) of
  253:         true -> ok;
  254:         false ->
  255:             %% Terminate any connected nodes. They may disturb test cases that follow.
  256:             lists:foreach(fun(Node) ->
  257:                                   catch erpc:call(Node, erlang, halt, [])
  258:                           end, nodes()),
  259:             ok
  260:     end.
  261: 
  262: %%-define(DEBUG,1).
  263: -ifdef(DEBUG).
  264: -define(dbg(Data),ct:pal("~p",[Data])).
  265: -else.
  266: -define(dbg(Data),noop).
  267: -endif.
  268: 
  269: string_to_term(Str) ->
  270:     {ok,Tokens,_EndLine} = erl_scan:string(Str ++ "."),
  271:     {ok,AbsForm} = erl_parse:parse_exprs(Tokens),
  272:     {value,Value,_Bs} = erl_eval:exprs(AbsForm, erl_eval:new_bindings()),
  273:     Value.
  274: 
  275: run_unbuffer_escript(Rows, Columns, EScript, NoTermStdIn, NoTermStdOut) ->
  276:     DataDir = filename:join(filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)), "interactive_shell_SUITE_data"),
  277:     TmpFile = filename:join(DataDir, "tmp"),
  278:     ok = file:write_file(TmpFile, <<>>),
  279:     CommandModifier =
  280:         case {NoTermStdIn, NoTermStdOut} of
  281:             {false, false} -> "";
  282:             {true, false} -> io_lib:format(" < ~s", [TmpFile]);
  283:             {false, true} -> io_lib:format(" > ~s ; cat ~s", [TmpFile, TmpFile]);
  284:             {true, true} -> io_lib:format(" > ~s < ~s ; cat ~s", [TmpFile, TmpFile, TmpFile])
  285:         end,
  286:     Command = io_lib:format("unbuffer -p bash -c \"stty rows ~p; stty columns ~p; escript ~s ~s\"",
  287:                             [Rows, Columns, EScript, CommandModifier]),
  288:     %% io:format("Command: ~s ~n", [Command]),
  289:     Out = os:cmd(Command),
  290:     %% io:format("Out: ~p ~n", [Out]),
  291:     string_to_term(Out).
  292: 
  293: get_columns_and_rows_escript(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  294:     ExpectUnbufferInstalled =
  295:         try
  296:             "79" = string:trim(os:cmd("unbuffer -p bash -c \"stty columns 79 ; tput cols\"")),
  297:             true
  298:         catch
  299:             _:_ -> false
  300:         end,
  301:     case ExpectUnbufferInstalled of
  302:         false ->
  303:             {skip,
  304:              "The unbuffer tool (https://core.tcl-lang.org/expect/index) does not seem to be installed.~n"
  305:              "On Ubuntu/Debian: \"sudo apt-get install expect\""};
  306:         true ->
  307:             DataDir = filename:join(filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)), "interactive_shell_SUITE_data"),
  308:             IoColumnsErl = filename:join(DataDir, "io_columns.erl"),
  309:             IoRowsErl = filename:join(DataDir, "io_rows.erl"),
  310:             [
  311:              begin
  312:                  {ok, 42} = run_unbuffer_escript(99, 42, IoColumnsErl, NoTermStdIn, NoTermStdOut),
  313:                  {ok, 99} = run_unbuffer_escript(99, 42, IoRowsErl, NoTermStdIn, NoTermStdOut)
  314:              end
  315:              ||
  316:                 {NoTermStdIn, NoTermStdOut} <- [{false, false}, {true, false}, {false, true}]
  317:             ],
  318:             {error,enotsup} = run_unbuffer_escript(99, 42, IoRowsErl, true, true),
  319:             {error,enotsup} = run_unbuffer_escript(99, 42, IoColumnsErl, true, true),
  320:             ok
  321:     end.
  322: 
  323: %% Test that the shell can access columns and rows.
  324: get_columns_and_rows(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  325:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
  326: 	old ->
  327:             test_columns_and_rows(old, []);
  328: 	new ->
  329:             test_columns_and_rows(old, ["-oldshell"]),
  330:             test_columns_and_rows(new, [])
  331:     end,
  332:     ok.
  333: 
  334: test_columns_and_rows(old, Args) ->
  335:     rtnode:run(
  336:       [{putline, ""},
  337:        {putline, "2."},
  338:        {expect, "2\r\n"},
  339:        {putline, "io:columns()."},
  340:        {expect, "{error,enotsup}\r\n"},
  341:        {putline, "io:rows()."},
  342:        {expect, "{error,enotsup}\r\n"}
  343:       ], [], [], Args),
  344: 
  345:     rtnode:run(
  346:       [{putline, ""},
  347:        {putline, "2."},
  348:        {expect, "2\r\n"},
  349:        {putline, "io:columns()."},
  350:        {expect, "{ok,90}\r\n"},
  351:        {putline,"io:rows()."},
  352:        {expect, "{ok,40}\r\n"}],
  353:       [],
  354:       "stty rows 40; stty columns 90; ",
  355:       Args);
  356: test_columns_and_rows(new, _Args) ->
  357:     rtnode:run(
  358:       [{putline, ""},
  359:        {expect, "1> $"},
  360:        {putline, "2."},
  361:        {expect, "\r\n2\r\n"},
  362:        {expect, "> $"},
  363:        {putline, "io:columns()."},
  364:        {expect, "{ok,80}\r\n"},
  365:        {expect, "> $"},
  366:        {putline, "io:rows()."},
  367:        {expect, "\r\n{ok,24}\r\n"}
  368:       ]),
  369: 
  370:     rtnode:run(
  371:       [{putline, ""},
  372:        {expect, "1> $"},
  373:        {putline, "2."},
  374:        {expect,  "\r\n2\r\n"},
  375:        {expect, "> $"},
  376:        {putline, "io:columns()."},
  377:        {expect, "\r\n{ok,90}\r\n"},
  378:        {expect, "> $"},
  379:        {putline, "io:rows()."},
  380:        {expect, "\r\n{ok,40}\r\n"}],
  381:       [],
  382:       "stty rows 40; stty columns 90; ").
  383: 
  384: shell_navigation(Config) ->
  385: 
  386:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  387: 
  388:     try
  389:         [begin
  390:              send_tty(Term,"{aaa,'b"++U++"b',ccc}"),
  391:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}), %% Check that cursor jump backward
  392:              check_content(Term, "{aaa,'b"++U++"b',ccc}$"),
  393:              timer:sleep(1000), %% Wait for cursor to jump back
  394:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,'b"++U++"b',ccc}")}),
  395:              send_tty(Term,"Home"),
  396:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  397:              send_tty(Term,"End"),
  398:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,'b"++U++"b',ccc}")}),
  399:              send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  400:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,'b"++U++"b',ccc")}),
  401:              send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  402:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,'b"++U++"b',")}),
  403:              send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  404:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,")}),
  405:              send_tty(Term,"C-Right"),
  406:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,'b"++U++"b'")}),
  407:              send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  408:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,")}),
  409:              send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  410:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{")}),
  411:              send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  412:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  413:              send_tty(Term,"C-E"),
  414:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,'b"++U++"b',ccc}")}),
  415:              send_tty(Term,"C-H"),
  416:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,'b"++U++"b',ccc")}),
  417:              send_tty(Term,"C-A"),
  418:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  419:              send_tty(Term,"Enter")
  420:          end || U <- hard_unicode()],
  421:         ok
  422:     after
  423:         stop_tty(Term)
  424:     end.
  425: shell_multiline_navigation(Config) ->
  426:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  427: 
  428:     try
  429:         [begin
  430:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  431:              send_tty(Term,"{aaa,"),
  432:              check_location(Term, {0,width("{aaa,")}),
  433:              send_tty(Term,"\n'b"++U++"b',"),
  434:              check_location(Term, {0, width("'b"++U++"b',")}),
  435:              send_tty(Term,"\nccc}"),
  436:              check_location(Term, {-2, 0}), %% Check that cursor jump backward (blink)
  437:              timer:sleep(1000), %% Wait for cursor to jump back
  438:              check_location(Term, {0, width("ccc}")}),
  439:              send_tty(Term,"Home"),
  440:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  441:              send_tty(Term,"End"),
  442:              check_location(Term, {0, width("ccc}")}),
  443:              send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  444:              check_location(Term, {0, width("ccc")}),
  445:              send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  446:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  447:              send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  448:              check_location(Term, {-1, width("'b"++U++"b',")}),
  449:              send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  450:              check_location(Term, {-1, 0}),
  451:              %send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  452:              %check_location(Term, {-1, 0}),
  453:              %send_tty(Term,"C-Right"),
  454:              %check_location(Term, {-1, 1}),
  455:              send_tty(Term,"C-Right"),
  456:              check_location(Term, {-1, width("'b"++U++"b'")}),
  457:              send_tty(Term,"C-Up"),
  458:              check_location(Term, {-2, width("{aaa,")}),
  459:              send_tty(Term,"C-Down"),
  460:              send_tty(Term,"C-Down"),
  461:              check_location(Term, {0, width("ccc}")}),
  462:              send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  463:              send_tty(Term,"C-Up"),
  464:              check_location(Term, {-1, width("'b"++U)}),
  465:              send_tty(Term,"M-<"),
  466:              check_location(Term, {-2, 0}),
  467:              send_tty(Term,"M->"),
  468:              send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  469:              check_location(Term, {0,width("ccc")}),
  470:              send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
  471:              send_tty(Term,"Right"),
  472:              check_location(Term, {0,0}),
  473:              send_tty(Term,"C-h"), % Backspace
  474:              check_location(Term, {-1,width("ccc}")}),
  475:              send_tty(Term, "C-Up"),
  476:              send_tty(Term, "End"),
  477:              send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  478:              send_tty(Term,"M-Enter"),
  479:              check_content(Term, ".. ,"),
  480:              check_location(Term, {-1,0}),
  481:              send_tty(Term,"M-c"),
  482:              check_location(Term, {-3,0}),
  483:              send_tty(Term,"{'"++U++"',\n\n\nworks}.\n")
  484:             end || U <- hard_unicode()],
  485:         ok
  486:     after
  487:         stop_tty(Term)
  488:     end.
  489: 
  490: shell_format(Config) ->
  491:     Term1 = start_tty([{args,["-stdlib","format_shell_func","{shell,erl_pp_format_func}"]}|Config]),
  492:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  493:     EmacsFormat = "\""++DataDir ++ "emacs-format-file\"\n",
  494:     try
  495:         send_tty(Term1,"fun(X) ->\n  X\nend.\n"),
  496:         send_tty(Term1,"Up"),
  497:         %% Note, erl_pp puts 7 spaces before X
  498:         check_content(Term1, "fun\\(X\\) ->\\s*..        X\\s*.. end."),
  499:         send_tty(Term1, "Down"),
  500:         tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term1)," -x ",200]),
  501:         timer:sleep(1000),
  502:         send_stdin(Term1, "shell:format_shell_func(\"emacs -batch \${file} -l \"\n"),
  503:         send_stdin(Term1, EmacsFormat),
  504:         send_stdin(Term1, "\" -f emacs-format-function\").\n"),
  505:         check_content(Term1, "{shell,erl_pp_format_func}"),
  506:         send_tty(Term1, "Up"),
  507:         send_tty(Term1, "Up"),
  508:         send_tty(Term1, "\n"),
  509:         timer:sleep(1000),
  510:         send_tty(Term1, "Up"),
  511:         %% Note, emacs-format puts 8 spaces before X
  512:         check_content(Term1, "fun\\(X\\) ->\\s*..         X\\s*.. end."),
  513:         send_tty(Term1, "Down"),
  514:         check_content(Term1, ">$"),
  515:         send_stdin(Term1, "shell:format_shell_func({bad,format}).\n"),
  516:         send_tty(Term1, "Up"),
  517:         send_tty(Term1, "Up"),
  518:         send_tty(Term1, "\n"),
  519:         timer:sleep(1000),
  520:         check_content(Term1, "\\Q* Bad format function: {bad,format}\\E"),
  521:         send_tty(Term1, "Up"),
  522:         %% No modifications should be made, when default format function is used
  523:         check_content(Term1, "fun\\(X\\) ->\\s*..         X\\s*.. end."),
  524:         ok
  525:     after
  526:         stop_tty(Term1)
  527:     end.
  528: 
  529: shell_multiline_prompt(Config) ->
  530:     Term1 = start_tty([{args,["-stdlib","shell_multiline_prompt","{shell,inverted_space_prompt}"]}|Config]),
  531:     Term2 = start_tty([{args,["-stdlib","shell_multiline_prompt","\"...> \""]}|Config]),
  532:     Term3 = start_tty([{args,["-stdlib","shell_multiline_prompt","edlin"]}|Config]),
  533:     Term4 = start_tty(Config),
  534:     try
  535:         check_location(Term1, {0, 0}),
  536:         send_tty(Term1,"\na"),
  537:         check_location(Term1, {0, 1}),
  538:         check_content(Term1, "   a"),
  539:         ok
  540:     after
  541:         stop_tty(Term1)
  542:     end,
  543:     try
  544:         check_location(Term2, {0, 0}),
  545:         send_tty(Term2,"\na"),
  546:         check_location(Term2, {0, 1}),
  547:         check_content(Term2, "...> a"),
  548:         ok
  549:     after
  550:         stop_tty(Term2)
  551:     end,
  552:     try
  553:         send_tty(Term3,"\na"),
  554:         check_location(Term3, {0, 1}),
  555:         check_content(Term3, ".. a"),
  556:         ok
  557:     after
  558:         stop_tty(Term3)
  559:     end,
  560:     try
  561:         send_tty(Term4, "shell:multiline_prompt_func(\"-> \").\n"),
  562:         check_content(Term4, "default"),
  563:         send_tty(Term4, "a\nb"),
  564:         check_content(Term4, "-> b"),
  565:         ok
  566:     after
  567:         stop_tty(Term4)
  568:     end.
  569: 
  570: shell_clear(Config) ->
  571: 
  572:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  573:     {Rows, _Cols} = get_window_size(Term),
  574: 
  575:     try
  576:         send_tty(Term,"foobar."),
  577:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
  578:         check_content(Term, "foobar"),
  579:         check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  580:         send_tty(Term,"bazbat"),
  581:         check_location(Term, {0, 6}),
  582:         send_tty(Term,"C-L"),
  583:         check_location(Term, {-Rows+1, 6}),
  584:         check_content(Term, "bazbat")
  585:     after
  586:         stop_tty(Term)
  587:     end.
  588: 
  589: shell_xnfix(Config) ->
  590: 
  591:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  592: 
  593:     {_Rows, Cols} = get_window_size(Term),
  594:     {_Row, Col} = get_location(Term),
  595: 
  596:     As = lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - 1,"a"),
  597: 
  598:     try
  599:         [begin
  600:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  601:              send_tty(Term,As),
  602:              check_content(Term,[As,$$]),
  603:              check_location(Term, {0, Cols - Col - 1}),
  604:              send_tty(Term,"a"),
  605:              check_location(Term, {0, -Col}),
  606:              send_tty(Term,"aaa"),
  607:              check_location(Term, {0, -Col + 3}),
  608:              [send_tty(Term,"Left") || _ <- lists:seq(1,3 + width(U))],
  609:              send_tty(Term,U),
  610:              %% a{Cols-1}U\naaaaa
  611:              check_content(Term,[lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - 1 - width(U),$a),
  612:                                  U,"\n",lists:duplicate(3+width(U), $a),"$"]),
  613:              check_location(Term, {0, -Col}),
  614:              send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  615:              send_tty(Term,U),
  616:              %% a{Cols-1}U\nUaaaaa
  617:              check_content(Term,[lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - 1 - width(U),$a),
  618:                                  U,"\n",U,lists:duplicate(3+width(U), $a),"$"]),
  619:              check_location(Term, {0, -Col}),
  620:              %% send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  621:              %% send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  622:              %% a{Cols-2}U\nUaaaaa
  623:              %% check_content(Term,[lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - 2 - width(U),$a),
  624:              %%                     U,"\n",U,lists:duplicate(3+width(U), $a),"$"]),
  625:              %% send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  626:              %% check_content(Term,[lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - 1 - width(U),$a),
  627:              %%                     U,U,"\n",lists:duplicate(3+width(U), $a),"$"]),
  628:              %% send_tty(Term,"aa"),
  629:              %% check_content(Term,[lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - 2 - width(U),$a),
  630:              %%                     U,"a\n",U,lists:duplicate(3+width(U), $a),"$"]),
  631:              %% check_location(Term, {0, -Col}),
  632:              send_tty(Term,"C-K"),
  633:              check_location(Term, {0, -Col}),
  634:              send_tty(Term,"C-A"),
  635:              check_location(Term, {-1, 0}),
  636:              send_tty(Term,"C-E"),
  637:              check_location(Term, {0, -Col}),
  638:              send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
  639:              ok
  640:          end || U <- hard_unicode()]
  641:     after
  642:         stop_tty(Term)
  643:     end.
  644: 
  645: 
  646: %% Characters that are larger than 2 wide need special handling when they
  647: %% are at the end of the current line.
  648: shell_unicode_wrap(Config) ->
  649: 
  650:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  651: 
  652:     {_Rows, Cols} = get_window_size(Term),
  653:     {_Row, Col} = get_location(Term),
  654: 
  655:     try
  656:         [begin
  657:              FirstLine = [U,lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - width(U)*2 + 1,"a")],
  658:              OtherLineA = [U,lists:duplicate(Cols - width(U) * 2+1,"a")],
  659:              OtherLineB = [U,lists:duplicate(Cols - width(U) * 2+1,"b")],
  660:              OtherLineC = [U,lists:duplicate(Cols - width(U) * 2+1,"c")],
  661:              OtherLineD = [U,lists:duplicate(Cols - width(U) * 2+1,"d")],
  662:              send_tty(Term,FirstLine),
  663:              check_content(Term, [FirstLine,$$]),
  664:              check_location(Term, {0, Cols - Col - width(U)+1}),
  665: 
  666:              send_tty(Term,OtherLineA),
  667:              check_content(Term, [OtherLineA,$$]),
  668:              check_location(Term, {0, Cols - Col - width(U)+1}),
  669: 
  670:              send_tty(Term,OtherLineB),
  671:              check_content(Term, [OtherLineB,$$]),
  672:              check_location(Term, {0, Cols - Col - width(U)+1}),
  673: 
  674:              send_tty(Term,OtherLineC),
  675:              check_content(Term, [OtherLineC,$$]),
  676:              check_location(Term, {0, Cols - Col - width(U)+1}),
  677: 
  678:              send_tty(Term,OtherLineD),
  679:              check_content(Term, [OtherLineD,$$]),
  680:              check_location(Term, {0, Cols - Col - width(U)+1}),
  681: 
  682:              send_tty(Term,"C-A"),
  683:              check_location(Term, {-4, 0}), %% Broken
  684:              send_tty(Term,"Right"),
  685:              check_location(Term, {-4, width(U)}), %% Broken
  686: 
  687:              send_tty(Term,"DC"), %% Broken
  688:              check_content(Term, ["a.*",U,"$"]),
  689:              check_content(Term, ["^b.*",U,"c$"]),
  690:              check_content(Term, ["^c.*",U,"dd$"]),
  691: 
  692:              send_tty(Term,"a"),
  693:              check_content(Term, [FirstLine,$$]),
  694:              check_content(Term, [OtherLineA,$$]),
  695:              check_content(Term, [OtherLineB,$$]),
  696:              check_content(Term, [OtherLineC,$$]),
  697:              check_content(Term, [OtherLineD,$$]),
  698: 
  699:              send_tty(Term,"Enter")
  700:          end || U <- hard_unicode()]
  701:     after
  702:         stop_tty(Term)
  703:     end.
  704: 
  705: shell_delete(Config) ->
  706: 
  707:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  708: 
  709:     try
  710: 
  711:         [ begin
  712:               send_tty(Term,"a"),
  713:               check_content(Term, "> a$"),
  714:               check_location(Term, {0, 1}),
  715:               send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  716:               check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  717:               check_content(Term, ">$"),
  718:               send_tty(Term,"a"),
  719:               send_tty(Term,U),
  720:               check_location(Term, {0, width([$a, U])}),
  721:               send_tty(Term,"a"),
  722:               send_tty(Term,U),
  723:               check_location(Term, {0, width([$a,U,$a,U])}),
  724:               check_content(Term, ["> a",U,$a,U,"$"]),
  725:               send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  726:               send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  727:               send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  728:               check_location(Term, {0, width([$a])}),
  729:               check_content(Term, ["> aa",U,"$"]),
  730:               send_tty(Term,U),
  731:               check_location(Term, {0, width([$a,U])}),
  732:               send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  733:               send_tty(Term,"DC"),
  734:               check_location(Term, {0, width([$a])}),
  735:               check_content(Term, ["> aa",U,"$"]),
  736:               send_tty(Term,"DC"),
  737:               send_tty(Term,"DC"),
  738:               check_content(Term, ["> a$"]),
  739:               send_tty(Term,"C-E"),
  740:               check_location(Term, {0, width([$a])}),
  741:               send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  742:               check_location(Term, {0, width([])})
  743:           end || U <- hard_unicode()]
  744:     after
  745:         stop_tty(Term)
  746:     end.
  747: 
  748: %% When deleting characters at the edge of the screen that are "large",
  749: %% we need to take special care.
  750: shell_delete_unicode_wrap(Config) ->
  751: 
  752:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  753: 
  754:     {_Rows, Cols} = get_window_size(Term),
  755:     {_Row, Col} = get_location(Term),
  756: 
  757:     try
  758:         [begin
  759:              send_tty(Term,lists:duplicate(Cols - Col,"a")),
  760:              check_content(Term,"> a*$"),
  761:              send_tty(Term,[U,U,"aaaaa"]),
  762:              check_content(Term,["\n",U,U,"aaaaa$"]),
  763:              [send_tty(Term,"Left") || _ <- lists:seq(1,5+2)],
  764:              check_location(Term,{0,-Col}),
  765:              send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  766:              check_content(Term,"> a* \n"),
  767:              check_location(Term,{-1,Cols - Col - 1}),
  768:              send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  769:              check_content(Term,["> a*",U,"\n"]),
  770:              check_location(Term,{-1,Cols - Col - 2}),
  771:              send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  772:              check_content(Term,["> a*",U," \n"]),
  773:              check_location(Term,{-1,Cols - Col - 3}),
  774:              send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  775:              check_content(Term,["> a*",U,U,"\n"]),
  776:              check_content(Term,["\naaaaa$"]),
  777:              check_location(Term,{-1,Cols - Col - 4}),
  778:              send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  779:              check_content(Term,["> a*",U,U,"a\n"]),
  780:              check_content(Term,["\naaaa$"]),
  781:              check_location(Term,{-1,Cols - Col - 5}),
  782:              send_tty(Term,"Enter")
  783:          end || U <- hard_unicode()]
  784:     after
  785:         stop_tty(Term)
  786:     end.
  787: 
  788: %% When deleting characters and a "large" characters is changing line we need
  789: %% to take extra care
  790: shell_delete_unicode_not_at_cursor_wrap(Config) ->
  791: 
  792:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  793: 
  794:     {_Rows, Cols} = get_window_size(Term),
  795:     {_Row, Col} = get_location(Term),
  796: 
  797:     try
  798:         [begin
  799:              send_tty(Term,lists:duplicate(Cols - Col,"a")),
  800:              check_content(Term,"> a*$"),
  801:              send_tty(Term,["a",U,"aaaaa"]),
  802:              check_content(Term,["\na",U,"aaaaa$"]),
  803:              send_tty(Term,"C-A"),
  804:              send_tty(Term,"DC"),
  805:              check_content(Term,["\n",U,"aaaaa$"]),
  806:              send_tty(Term,"DC"),
  807:              check_content(Term,["\n",U,"aaaaa$"]),
  808:              check_content(Term,["> a* \n"]),
  809:              send_tty(Term,"DC"),
  810:              check_content(Term,["\naaaaa$"]),
  811:              check_content(Term,["> a*",U,"\n"]),
  812:              send_tty(Term,"DC"),
  813:              check_content(Term,["\naaaa$"]),
  814:              check_content(Term,["> a*",U,"a\n"]),
  815:              send_tty(Term,"Enter")
  816:          end || U <- hard_unicode()]
  817:     after
  818:         stop_tty(Term)
  819:     end.
  820: 
  821: %% When deleting characters and a "large" characters is changing line we need
  822: %% to take extra care
  823: shell_update_window_unicode_wrap(Config) ->
  824: 
  825:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  826: 
  827:     {_Rows, Cols} = get_window_size(Term),
  828:     {_Row, Col} = get_location(Term),
  829: 
  830:     try
  831:         [begin
  832:              send_tty(Term,lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - width(U) + 1,"a")),
  833:              check_content(Term,"> a*$"),
  834:              send_tty(Term,[U,"aaaaa"]),
  835:              check_content(Term,["> a* ?\n",U,"aaaaa$"]),
  836:              tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x ",Cols+1]),
  837:              check_content(Term,["> a*",U,"\naaaaa$"]),
  838:              tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x ",Cols]),
  839:              check_content(Term,["> a* ?\n",U,"aaaaa$"]),
  840:              send_tty(Term,"Enter")
  841:          end || U <- hard_unicode()]
  842:     after
  843:         stop_tty(Term)
  844:     end.
  845: 
  846: shell_transpose(Config) ->
  847: 
  848:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  849: 
  850:     Unicode = [[$a]] ++ hard_unicode(),
  851: 
  852:     try
  853:         [
  854:          begin
  855:              send_tty(Term,"a"),
  856:              [send_tty(Term,[CP]) || CP <- U],
  857:              send_tty(Term,"b"),
  858:              [[send_tty(Term,[CP]) || CP <- U2] || U2 <- Unicode],
  859:              send_tty(Term,"cde"),
  860:              check_content(Term, ["a",U,"b",Unicode,"cde$"]),
  861:              check_location(Term, {0, width(["a",U,"b",Unicode,"cde"])}),
  862:              send_tty(Term,"Home"),
  863:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  864:              send_tty(Term,"Right"),
  865:              send_tty(Term,"Right"),
  866:              check_location(Term, {0, 1+width([U])}),
  867:              send_tty(Term,"C-T"),
  868:              check_content(Term, ["ab",U,Unicode,"cde$"]),
  869:              send_tty(Term,"C-T"),
  870:              check_content(Term, ["ab",hd(Unicode),U,tl(Unicode),"cde$"]),
  871:              [send_tty(Term,"C-T") || _ <- lists:seq(1,length(Unicode)-1)],
  872:              check_content(Term, ["ab",Unicode,U,"cde$"]),
  873:              send_tty(Term,"C-T"),
  874:              check_content(Term, ["ab",Unicode,"c",U,"de$"]),
  875:              check_location(Term, {0, width(["ab",Unicode,"c",U])}),
  876:              send_tty(Term,"End"),
  877:              check_location(Term, {0, width(["ab",Unicode,"c",U,"de"])}),
  878:              send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  879:              send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  880:              send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  881:              check_content(Term, ["ab",Unicode,"cde$"]),
  882:              send_tty(Term,"End"),
  883:              send_tty(Term,"Enter")
  884:          end || U <- Unicode],
  885:         ok
  886:     after
  887:         stop_tty(Term),
  888:         ok
  889:     end.
  890: 
  891: shell_search(C) ->
  892:     Term = start_tty(C),
  893: 
  894:     try
  895:         send_tty(Term,"a"),
  896:         send_tty(Term,"."),
  897:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
  898:         send_tty(Term,"'"),
  899:         send_tty(Term,"a"),
  900:         send_tty(Term,[16#1f600]),
  901:         send_tty(Term,"'"),
  902:         send_tty(Term,"."),
  903:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
  904:         check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  905:         send_tty(Term,"C-r"),
  906:         check_content(Term, "search:\\s*\n\\s*'a😀'."),
  907:         send_tty(Term,"C-a"),
  908:         check_location(Term, {-1, width(C, "'a😀'.")}),
  909:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
  910:         send_tty(Term,"C-r"),
  911:         check_content(Term, "search:\\s*\n\\s*'a😀'."),
  912:         send_tty(Term,"a"),
  913:         check_content(Term, "search: a\\s*\n\\s*'a😀'."),
  914:         send_tty(Term,"C-r"),
  915:         check_content(Term, "search: a\\s*\n\\s*a."),
  916:         send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  917:         check_content(Term, "search:\\s*\n\\s*'a😀'."),
  918:         send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  919:         check_content(Term, "search:\\s*\n\\s*'a😀'."),
  920:         send_tty(Term,"M-c"),
  921:         check_location(Term, {-1, 0}),
  922:         ok
  923:     after
  924:         stop_tty(Term),
  925:         ok
  926:     end.
  927: 
  928: shell_insert(Config) ->
  929:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  930: 
  931:     try
  932:         send_tty(Term,"abcdefghijklm"),
  933:         check_content(Term, "abcdefghijklm$"),
  934:         check_location(Term, {0, 13}),
  935:         send_tty(Term,"Home"),
  936:         send_tty(Term,"Right"),
  937:         send_tty(Term,"C-T"),
  938:         send_tty(Term,"C-T"),
  939:         send_tty(Term,"C-T"),
  940:         send_tty(Term,"C-T"),
  941:         check_content(Term, "bcdeafghijklm$"),
  942:         send_tty(Term,"End"),
  943:         send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  944:         send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  945:         send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  946:         check_content(Term, "bcdeafghijlm$"),
  947:         ok
  948:     after
  949:         stop_tty(Term)
  950:     end.
  951: 
  952: shell_update_window(Config) ->
  953:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  954: 
  955:     Text = lists:flatten(["abcdefghijklmabcdefghijklm"]),
  956:     {_Row, Col} = get_location(Term),
  957: 
  958:     try
  959:         send_tty(Term,Text),
  960:         check_content(Term,Text),
  961:         check_location(Term, {0, width(Text)}),
  962:         tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x ",width(Text)+Col+1]),
  963:         send_tty(Term,"a"),
  964:         check_location(Term, {0, -Col}),
  965:         send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  966:         check_location(Term, {-1, width(Text)}),
  967:         tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x ",width(Text)+Col]),
  968:         %% When resizing, tmux does not xnfix the cursor, so it will remain
  969:         %% at the previous locations
  970:         check_location(Term, {-1, width(Text)}),
  971:         send_tty(Term,"a"),
  972:         check_location(Term, {0, -Col + 1}),
  973: 
  974:         %% When we do backspace here, tmux seems to place the cursor in an
  975:         %% incorrect position except when a terminal is attached.
  976:         send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  977:         %% This really should be {0, -Col}, but sometimes tmux sets it to
  978:         %% {-1, width(Text)} instead.
  979:         check_location(Term, [{0, -Col}, {-1, width(Text)}]),
  980: 
  981:         tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x ",width(Text) div 2 + Col]),
  982:         %% Depending on what happened with the cursor above, the line will be
  983:         %% different here.
  984:         check_location(Term, [{0, -Col + width(Text) div 2},
  985:                               {-1, -Col + width(Text) div 2}]),
  986:         ok
  987:     after
  988:         stop_tty(Term)
  989:     end.
  990: shell_small_window_multiline_navigation(Config) ->
  991:     Term0 = start_tty(Config),
  992:     tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term0)," -x ",30, " -y ", 6]),
  993:     {Row, Col} = get_location(Term0),
  994:     Term = Term0#tmux{orig_location = {Row, Col}},
  995:     Text = ("xbcdefghijklmabcdefghijklm\n"++
  996:         "abcdefghijkl\n"++
  997:         "abcdefghijklmabcdefghijklm\n"++
  998:         "abcdefghijklmabcdefghijklx"),
  999:     try
 1000:         send_tty(Term,Text),
 1001:         check_location(Term, {0, -4}),
 1002:         send_tty(Term,"Home"),
 1003:         check_location(Term, {-1, 0}),
 1004:         send_tty(Term, "C-Up"),
 1005:         check_location(Term, {-2, 0}),
 1006:         send_tty(Term, "C-Down"),
 1007:         check_location(Term, {-1, 0}),
 1008:         send_tty(Term, "Left"),
 1009:         check_location(Term, {-1, -4}),
 1010:         send_tty(Term, "Right"),
 1011:         check_location(Term, {-1, 0}),
 1012:         send_tty(Term, "\e[1;4A"),
 1013:         check_location(Term, {-5, 0}),
 1014:         check_content(Term,"xbc"),
 1015:         send_tty(Term, "\e[1;4B"),
 1016:         check_location(Term, {0, -4}),
 1017:         check_content(Term,"klx"),
 1018:         send_tty(Term, " sets:is_e\t"),
 1019:         check_content(Term,"is_element"),
 1020:         check_content(Term,"is_empty"),
 1021:         check_location(Term, {-3, 6}),
 1022:         send_tty(Term, "C-Up"),
 1023:         send_tty(Term,"Home"),
 1024:         check_location(Term, {-2, 0}),
 1025:         send_tty(Term, "sets:is_e\t"),
 1026:         check_content(Term,"is_element"),
 1027:         check_content(Term,"is_empty"),
 1028:         check_location(Term, {-4, 9}),
 1029:         send_tty(Term, "M-Enter"),
 1030:         check_location(Term, {-1, 0}),
 1031:         ok
 1032:     after
 1033:         stop_tty(Term)
 1034:     end.
 1035: shell_huge_input(Config) ->
 1036:     Term = start_tty(Config),
 1037: 
 1038:     ManyUnicode = lists:duplicate(100,hard_unicode()),
 1039: 
 1040:     try
 1041:         send_tty(Term,ManyUnicode),
 1042:         check_content(Term, hard_unicode_match(Config) ++ "$",
 1043:                       #{ replace => {"\n",""} }),
 1044:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
 1045:         ok
 1046:     after
 1047:         stop_tty(Term)
 1048:     end.
 1049: shell_receive_standard_out(Config) ->
 1050:     Term = start_tty(Config),
 1051:     try
 1052:         send_tty(Term,"my_fun(5) -> ok; my_fun(N) -> receive after 100 -> io:format(\"~p\\n\", [N]), my_fun(N+1) end.\n"),
 1053:         send_tty(Term, "spawn(shell_default, my_fun, [0]). ABC\n"),
 1054:         timer:sleep(1000),
 1055:         check_location(Term, {0, 0}), %% Check that we are at the same location relative to the start.
 1056:         check_content(Term, "3\\s+4\\s+.+>\\sABC"),
 1057:         ok
 1058:     after
 1059:         stop_tty(Term)
 1060:     end.
 1061: %% Test that the shell works when invalid utf-8 (aka latin1) is sent to it
 1062: shell_invalid_unicode(Config) ->
 1063:     Term = start_tty(Config),
 1064: 
 1065:     InvalidUnicode = <<$å,$ä,$ö>>, %% åäö in latin1
 1066: 
 1067:     try
 1068:         send_tty(Term,hard_unicode()),
 1069:         check_content(Term, hard_unicode() ++ "$"),
 1070:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
 1071:         check_content(Term, "illegal character"),
 1072:         %% Send invalid utf-8
 1073:         send_stdin(Term,InvalidUnicode),
 1074:         %% Check that the utf-8 was echoed
 1075:         check_content(Term, "\\\\345\\\\344\\\\366$"),
 1076:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
 1077:         %% Check that the terminal entered "latin1" mode
 1078:         send_tty(Term,"😀한."),
 1079:         check_content(Term, "\\Q\\360\\237\\230\\200\\355\\225\\234.\\E$"),
 1080:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
 1081:         %% Check that we can reset the encoding to unicode
 1082:         send_tty(Term,"io:setopts([{encoding,unicode}])."),
 1083:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
 1084:         check_content(Term, "\nok\n"),
 1085:         send_tty(Term,"😀한"),
 1086:         check_content(Term, "😀한$"),
 1087:         ok
 1088:     after
 1089:         stop_tty(Term),
 1090:         ok
 1091:     end.
 1092: 
 1093: 
 1094: %% Test the we can handle ansi insert, navigation and delete
 1095: %%   We currently can not so skip this test
 1096: shell_support_ansi_input(Config) ->
 1097: 
 1098:     Term = start_tty(Config),
 1099: 
 1100:     BoldText = "\e[;1m",
 1101:     ClearText = "\e[0m",
 1102: 
 1103:     try
 1104:         send_tty(Term,["{",BoldText,"a😀b",ClearText,"}"]),
 1105:         timer:sleep(1000),
 1106:         try check_location(Term, {0, width("{1ma😀bm}")}) of
 1107:             _ ->
 1108:                 throw({skip, "Do not support ansi input"})
 1109:         catch _:_ ->
 1110:                 ok
 1111:         end,
 1112:         check_location(Term, {0, width("{a😀b}")}),
 1113:         check_content(fun() -> get_content(Term,"-e") end,
 1114:                       ["{", BoldText, "a😀b", ClearText, "}"]),
 1115:         send_tty(Term,"Left"),
 1116:         send_tty(Term,"Left"),
 1117:         check_location(Term, {0, width("{a😀")}),
 1118:         send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
 1119:         check_location(Term, {0, width("{")}),
 1120:         send_tty(Term,"End"),
 1121:         send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
 1122:         send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
 1123:         check_content(Term, ["{", BoldText, "a😀"]),
 1124:         ok
 1125:     after
 1126:         stop_tty(Term),
 1127:         ok
 1128:     end.
 1129: 
 1130: shell_expand_location_below(Config) ->
 1131: 
 1132:     Term = start_tty(Config),
 1133: 
 1134:     {Rows, _} = get_window_size(Term),
 1135:     {Row, Col} = get_location(Term),
 1136: 
 1137:     NumFunctions = lists:seq(0, Row*2),
 1138:     FunctionName = "a_long_function_name",
 1139: 
 1140:     Module = lists:flatten(
 1141:                ["-module(long_module).\n",
 1142:                 "-export([",lists:join($,,[io_lib:format("~s~p/0",[FunctionName,I]) || I <- NumFunctions]),"]).\n\n",
 1143:                 [io_lib:format("~s~p() -> ok.\n",[FunctionName,I]) || I <- NumFunctions]]),
 1144: 
 1145:     DoScan = fun F([]) ->
 1146:                      [];
 1147:                  F(Str) ->
 1148:                      {done,{ok,T,_},C} = erl_scan:tokens([],Str,0),
 1149:                      [ T | F(C) ]
 1150:              end,
 1151:     Forms = [ begin {ok,Y} = erl_parse:parse_form(X),Y end || X <- DoScan(Module) ],
 1152:     {ok,_,Bin} = compile:forms(Forms, [debug_info]),
 1153: 
 1154:     try
 1155:         tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x 80"]),
 1156:         Cols = 80,
 1157: 
 1158:         %% First check that basic completion works
 1159:         send_tty(Term, "escript:"),
 1160:         send_tty(Term, "\t"),
 1161:         %% Cursor at correct place
 1162:         check_location(Term, {-3, width("escript:")}),
 1163:         %% Nothing after the start( completion
 1164:         check_content(Term, "start\\($"),
 1165: 
 1166:         %% Check that completion is cleared when we type
 1167:         send_tty(Term, "s"),
 1168:         check_location(Term, {-3, width("escript:s")}),
 1169:         check_content(Term, "escript:s$"),
 1170: 
 1171:         %% Check that completion works when in the middle of a term
 1172:         send_tty(Term, "Home"),
 1173:         send_tty(Term, "["),
 1174:         send_tty(Term, "End"),
 1175:         send_tty(Term, ", test_after]"),
 1176:         [send_tty(Term, "Left") || _ <- ", test_after]"],
 1177:         send_tty(Term, "\t"),
 1178:         check_location(Term, {-3, width("[escript:s")}),
 1179:         check_content(Term, "script_name\\([ ]+start\\($"),
 1180:         send_tty(Term, "C-K"),
 1181: 
 1182:         %% Check that completion works when in the middle of a long term
 1183:         send_tty(Term, ", "++ lists:duplicate(80*2, $a)++"]"),
 1184:         [send_tty(Term, "Left") || _ <- ", "++ lists:duplicate(80*2, $a)++"]"],
 1185:         send_tty(Term, "\t"),
 1186:         check_location(Term, {-4, width("[escript:s")}),
 1187:         check_content(Term, "script_name\\([ ]+start\\($"),
 1188:         send_tty(Term, "End"),
 1189:         send_tty(Term, ".\n"),
 1190: 
 1191:         %% Check that we behave as we should with very long completions
 1192:         rpc(Term, fun() ->
 1193:                           {module, long_module} = code:load_binary(long_module, "long_module.beam", Bin)
 1194:                   end),
 1195:         check_content(Term, "3>"),
 1196:         tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -y 50"]),
 1197:         timer:sleep(1000), %% Sleep to make sure window has resized
 1198:         Result = 61,
 1199:         Rows1 = 48,
 1200:         send_tty(Term, "long_module:" ++ FunctionName),
 1201:         send_tty(Term, "\t"),
 1202:         check_content(Term, "3> long_module:" ++ FunctionName ++ "\nfunctions(\n|.)*a_long_function_name0\\("),
 1203: 
 1204:         %% Check that correct text is printed below expansion
 1205:         check_content(Term, io_lib:format("rows ~w to ~w of ~w",
 1206:                                           [1, 7, Result])),
 1207:         send_tty(Term, "\t"),
 1208:         check_content(Term, io_lib:format("rows ~w to ~w of ~w",
 1209:             [1, Rows1, Result])),
 1210:         send_tty(Term, "Down"),
 1211:         check_content(Term, io_lib:format("rows ~w to ~w of ~w",
 1212:                                           [2, Rows1+1, Result])),
 1213:         send_tty(Term, "PgDn"),
 1214:         check_content(Term, io_lib:format("rows ~w to ~w of ~w",
 1215:                                           [7, Rows1+6, Result])),
 1216:         send_tty(Term, "PgUp"),
 1217:         check_content(Term, io_lib:format("rows ~w to ~w of ~w",
 1218:                                           [2, Rows1+1, Result])),
 1219:         send_tty(Term, "PgUp"),
 1220:         %% Overshoot up
 1221:         check_content(Term, io_lib:format("rows ~w to ~w of ~w",
 1222:                                           [1, Rows1, Result])),
 1223:         %% Overshoot down
 1224:         send_tty(Term, "PgDn"),
 1225:         send_tty(Term, "PgDn"),
 1226:         send_tty(Term, "PgDn"),
 1227:         check_content(Term, io_lib:format("rows ~w to ~w of ~w",
 1228:                                           [14, Rows1+13, Result])),
 1229:         check_content(Term, "\n.*a_long_function_name99\\("),
 1230:         send_tty(Term, "Up"),
 1231:         check_content(Term, io_lib:format("rows ~w to ~w of ~w",
 1232:                                           [13, Rows1+12, Result])),
 1233: 
 1234:         send_tty(Term, "\t"),
 1235: 
 1236:         %% We resize the terminal to make everything fit and test that
 1237:         %% expand below displays everything
 1238:         tmux(["resize-window -t ", tty_name(Term), " -y ", integer_to_list(Row+10)]),
 1239:         timer:sleep(1000), %% Sleep to make sure window has resized
 1240:         send_tty(Term, "\t\t"),
 1241:         check_content(Term, "3> long_module:" ++ FunctionName ++ "\nfunctions(\n|.)*a_long_function_name99\\($"),
 1242: 
 1243:         %% Check that doing an expansion when cursor is in xnfix position works
 1244:         send_tty(Term, "BSpace"),
 1245:         check_content(Term, "3> long_module:a_long_function_nam$"),
 1246:         send_tty(Term, "Home"),
 1247:         send_tty(Term, lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - width(", long_module:a_long_function_name"), "a")),
 1248:         send_tty(Term, ", "),
 1249:         send_tty(Term, "End"),
 1250:         send_tty(Term, "\t"),
 1251:         check_location(Term, {-Rows + 2, -Col}),
 1252:         send_tty(Term, "\t"),
 1253:         check_content(Term, "3> a+, long_module:" ++ FunctionName ++ "\n\nfunctions(\n|.)*a_long_function_name0\\("),
 1254:         check_location(Term, {-Rows + 2, -Col}),
 1255:         send_tty(Term, "Down"),
 1256:         check_location(Term, {-Rows + 2, -Col}),
 1257:         send_tty(Term, "Down"),
 1258:         check_location(Term, {-Rows + 2, -Col}),
 1259: 
 1260:         send_tty(Term, "Home"),
 1261:         send_tty(Term, lists:duplicate(Cols, "b")),
 1262:         send_tty(Term, "End"),
 1263:         send_tty(Term, "\t"),
 1264:         check_content(Term, "3> b+\nb+a+, long_module:" ++ FunctionName ++ "\n\nfunctions(\n|.)*a_long_function_name0\\("),
 1265:         check_location(Term, {-Rows + 3, -Col}),
 1266:         send_tty(Term, "Down"),
 1267:         check_location(Term, {-Rows + 3, -Col}),
 1268:         send_tty(Term, "Down"),
 1269:         check_location(Term, {-Rows + 3, -Col}),
 1270: 
 1271:         ok
 1272:     after
 1273:         stop_tty(Term),
 1274:         ok
 1275:     end.
 1276: 
 1277: shell_expand_location_above(Config) ->
 1278: 
 1279:     Term = start_tty([{args,["-stdlib","shell_expand_location","above"]}|Config]),
 1280: 
 1281:     try
 1282:         tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x 80"]),
 1283:         send_tty(Term, "escript:"),
 1284:         send_tty(Term, "\t"),
 1285:         check_location(Term, {0, width("escript:")}),
 1286:         check_content(Term, "start\\(\n"),
 1287:         check_content(Term, "escript:$"),
 1288:         send_tty(Term, "s"),
 1289:         send_tty(Term, "\t"),
 1290:         check_location(Term, {0, width("escript:s")}),
 1291:         check_content(Term, "\nscript_name\\([ ]+start\\(\n"),
 1292:         check_content(Term, "escript:s$"),
 1293:         ok
 1294:     after
 1295:         stop_tty(Term),
 1296:         ok
 1297:     end.
 1298: 
 1299: shell_help(Config) ->
 1300:     Term = start_tty(Config),
 1301:     try
 1302:         send_tty(Term, "application:put_env(kernel, shell_docs_ansi, false).\n"),
 1303:         send_tty(Term, "lists"),
 1304:         send_tty(Term, "\^[h"),
 1305:         %% Check we can see the first line
 1306:         check_content(Term, "List processing functions."),
 1307:         check_not_in_content(Term, "less than or equal to"),
 1308:         %% Expand the help area to take up the whole buffer.
 1309:         send_tty(Term, "\^[h"),
 1310:         %% Check that we can see the last line (lists help should fit in the window)
 1311:         check_content(Term, "less than or equal to"),
 1312:         send_tty(Term, ":all"),
 1313:         send_tty(Term, "\^[h"),
 1314:         check_content(Term, ~S"all\(Pred, List\)"),
 1315:         ok
 1316:     after
 1317:         stop_tty(Term),
 1318:         ok
 1319:     end.
 1320: %% Test the we can handle invalid ansi escape chars.
 1321: %%   tmux cannot handle this... so we test this using to_erl
 1322: shell_invalid_ansi(_Config) ->
 1323: 
 1324:     InvalidAnsiPrompt =
 1325:         case proplists:get_value(encoding, io:getopts(user)) of
 1326:             unicode ->
 1327:                 ["\e]94m",54620,44397,50612,47,51312,49440,47568,"\e]0m"];
 1328:             latin1 ->
 1329:                 ["\e]94minvalid_test\e]0m"]
 1330:         end,
 1331: 
 1332:     rtnode:run(
 1333:       [{eval, fun() -> application:set_env(
 1334:                          stdlib, shell_prompt_func_test,
 1335:                          fun() -> InvalidAnsiPrompt end)
 1336:               end },
 1337:        {putline,"a."},
 1338:        {expect, "a[.]"},
 1339:        {expect, ["\\Q",InvalidAnsiPrompt,"\\E"]}],
 1340:       "", "",
 1341:       ["-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1342:        "-connect_all","false",
 1343:        "-kernel","logger_level","all",
 1344:        "-kernel","shell_history","disabled",
 1345:        "-kernel","prevent_overlapping_partitions","false",
 1346:        "-eval","shell:prompt_func({interactive_shell_SUITE,prompt})."
 1347:       ]).
 1348: 
 1349: shell_get_password(_Config) ->
 1350:    
 1351:     rtnode:run(
 1352:       [{putline,"io:get_password()."},
 1353:        {putline,"secret\r"},
 1354:        {expect, "\r\n\"secret\""}]),
 1355: 
 1356:     %% io:get_password only works when run in "newshell"
 1357:     rtnode:run(
 1358:       [{putline,"io:get_password()."},
 1359:        {expect, "\\Q{error,enotsup}\\E"}],
 1360:      "","",["-oldshell"]).
 1361: 
 1362: 
 1363: shell_ignore_pager_commands(Config) ->
 1364:     Term = start_tty(Config),
 1365:     case code:get_doc(file, #{sources=>[eep48]}) of
 1366:         {error, _} -> {skip, "No documentation available"};
 1367:         _ ->
 1368:             try
 1369:                 send_tty(Term, "h(file).\n"),
 1370:                 check_content(Term,"\\Qmore (y/n)? (y)\\E"),
 1371:                 send_tty(Term, "n\n"),
 1372:                 check_content(Term,"ok"),
 1373:                 send_tty(Term, "C-P"),
 1374:                 check_content(Term,"\\Qh(file).\\E"),
 1375:                 ok
 1376:             after
 1377:                 stop_tty(Term),
 1378:                 ok
 1379:             end
 1380:     end.
 1381: test_valid_keymap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1382:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config),
 1383:     Term = setup_tty([{args, ["-config", DataDir ++ "valid_keymap.config"]} | Config]),
 1384:     Prompt = fun() -> ["\e[94m",54620,44397,50612,47,51312,49440,47568,"\e[0m"] end,
 1385:     erpc:call(Term#tmux.node, application, set_env,
 1386:               [stdlib, shell_prompt_func_test,
 1387:                proplists:get_value(shell_prompt_func_test, Config, Prompt)]),
 1388:     try
 1389:         check_not_in_content(Term, "Invalid key"),
 1390:         check_not_in_content(Term, "Invalid function"),
 1391:         send_tty(Term, "asdf"),
 1392:         send_tty(Term, "C-u"),
 1393:         check_content(Term, ">$"),
 1394:         send_tty(Term, "1.\n"),
 1395:         send_tty(Term, "C-b"),
 1396:         check_content(Term, "2>\\s1.$"),
 1397:         ok
 1398:     after
 1399:         stop_tty(Term),
 1400:         ok
 1401:     end.
 1402: 
 1403: test_invalid_keymap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1404:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config),
 1405:     Term1 = setup_tty([{args, ["-config", DataDir ++ "invalid_keymap.config"]} | Config]),
 1406:     try
 1407:         check_content(Term1, "Invalid key"),
 1408:         check_content(Term1, "Invalid function"),
 1409:         send_tty(Term1, "asdf"),
 1410:         send_tty(Term1, "C-u"),
 1411:         check_content(Term1, ">$"),
 1412:         ok
 1413:     after
 1414:         stop_tty(Term1),
 1415:         ok
 1416:     end.
 1417: external_editor(Config) ->
 1418:     case os:find_executable("nano") of
 1419:         false -> {skip, "nano is not installed"};
 1420:         _ ->
 1421:             Term = start_tty(Config),
 1422:             try
 1423:                 tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x 80"]),
 1424:                 send_tty(Term,"os:putenv(\"EDITOR\",\"nano\").\n"),
 1425:                 send_tty(Term, "\"some text with\nnewline in it\""),
 1426:                 check_content(Term,"3> \"some text with\\s*\n.+\\s*newline in it\""),
 1427:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"),
 1428:                 check_content(Term,"GNU nano [\\d.]+"),
 1429:                 check_content(Term,"\"some text with\\s*\n\\s*newline in it\""),
 1430:                 send_tty(Term, "Right"),
 1431:                 send_tty(Term, "still"),
 1432:                 send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1433:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"), %% save in nano
 1434:                 send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1435:                 send_tty(Term, "C-X"), %% quit in nano
 1436:                 check_content(Term,"3> \"still\\s*\n\\s*.+\\s*some text with\\s*\n.+\\s*newline in it\""),
 1437:                 send_tty(Term,".\n"),
 1438:                 check_content(Term,"\\Q\"still\\nsome text with\\nnewline in it\"\\E"),
 1439:                 ok
 1440:             after
 1441:                 stop_tty(Term),
 1442:                 ok
 1443:             end
 1444:     end.
 1445: 
 1446: external_editor_visual(Config) ->
 1447:     case os:find_executable("vim") of
 1448:         false ->
 1449:             {skip, "vim is not installed"};
 1450:         _ ->
 1451:             Term = start_tty(Config),
 1452:             try
 1453:                 tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x 80"]),
 1454:                 send_tty(Term,"os:putenv(\"EDITOR\",\"nano\").\n"),
 1455:                 check_content(Term, "3>"),
 1456:                 send_tty(Term,"os:putenv(\"VISUAL\",\"vim -u DEFAULTS -U NONE -i NONE\").\n"),
 1457:                 check_content(Term, "4>"),
 1458:                 send_tty(Term,"\"hello"),
 1459:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"), %% Open vim
 1460:                 check_content(Term, "^\"hello"),
 1461:                 send_tty(Term, "$"), %% Set cursor at end
 1462:                 send_tty(Term, "a"), %% Enter insert mode at end
 1463:                 check_content(Term, "-- INSERT --"),
 1464:                 send_tty(Term, "\"."),
 1465:                 send_tty(Term,"Escape"),
 1466:                 send_tty(Term,":wq"),
 1467:                 send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
 1468:                 check_content(Term, "\"hello\"[.]$"),
 1469:                 send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
 1470:                 check_content(Term, "\"hello\""),
 1471:                 check_content(Term, "5>$")
 1472:             after
 1473:                 stop_tty(Term),
 1474:                 ok
 1475:             end
 1476:     end.
 1477: 
 1478: external_editor_unicode(Config) ->
 1479:     NanoPath = os:find_executable("nano"),
 1480:     case NanoPath of
 1481:         false -> {skip, "nano is not installed"};
 1482:         _ ->
 1483:             Term = start_tty(Config),
 1484:             try
 1485:                 tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x 80"]),
 1486:                 send_tty(Term,"os:putenv(\"EDITOR\",\"nano\").\n"),
 1487:                 send_tty(Term, hard_unicode()),
 1488:                 check_content(Term,"3> " ++ hard_unicode_match(Config)),
 1489:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"), %% open external editor (nano)
 1490:                 check_content(Term,"GNU nano [\\d.]+"),
 1491:                 send_tty(Term, "still "),
 1492:                 check_content(Term,"\nstill "),
 1493:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"), %% save in nano
 1494:                 send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1495:                 send_tty(Term, "C-X"), %% quit in nano
 1496:                 check_content(Term,"still "++hard_unicode_match(Config)),
 1497:                 ok
 1498:             after
 1499:                 stop_tty(Term),
 1500:                 ok
 1501:             end
 1502:     end.
 1503: 
 1504: %% There used to be a race condition when using shell:start_interactive where
 1505: %% the newline handling of standard_error did not change correctly to compensate
 1506: %% for the tty changing to canonical mode
 1507: shell_standard_error_nlcr(Config) ->
 1508: 
 1509:     [
 1510:      begin
 1511:          Term = setup_tty([{env,[{"TERM",TERM}]},{args, ["-noshell"]} | Config]),
 1512:          try
 1513:              rpc(Term, io, format, [standard_error,"test~ntest~ntest", []]),
 1514:              check_content(Term, "test\ntest\ntest$"),
 1515:              rpc(Term, fun() -> shell:start_interactive(),
 1516:                                 io:format(standard_error,"test~ntest~ntest", [])
 1517:                        end),
 1518:              check_content(Term, "test\ntest\ntest(\n|.)*test\ntest\ntest")
 1519:          after
 1520:              stop_tty(Term)
 1521:          end
 1522:      end || TERM <- ["dumb",os:getenv("TERM")]].
 1523: 
 1524: %% We test that suspending of `erl` and then resuming restores the shell
 1525: shell_suspend(Config) ->
 1526: 
 1527:     Name = peer:random_name(proplists:get_value(tc_path,Config)),
 1528:     %% In order to suspend `erl` we need it to run in a shell that has job control
 1529:     %% so we start the peer within a tmux window instead of having it be the original
 1530:     %% process.
 1531:     os:cmd("tmux new-window -n " ++ Name ++ " -d -- bash --norc"),
 1532: 
 1533:     Peer = #{ name => Name,
 1534:               post_process_args =>
 1535:                         fun(["new-window","-n",_,"-d","--"|CmdAndArgs]) ->
 1536:                                 FlatCmdAndArgs =
 1537:                                       lists:join(
 1538:                                         " ",[[$',A,$'] || A <- CmdAndArgs]),
 1539:                                 ["send","-t",Name,lists:flatten(FlatCmdAndArgs),"Enter"]
 1540:                         end
 1541:             },
 1542: 
 1543: 
 1544:     Term = start_tty([{peer, Peer}|Config]),
 1545: 
 1546:     try
 1547:         send_tty(Term, hard_unicode()),
 1548:         check_content(Term,["2> ",hard_unicode(),"$"]),
 1549:         send_tty(Term, "C-Z"),
 1550:         check_content(Term,"\\Q[1]+\\E\\s*Stopped"),
 1551:         send_tty(Term, "fg"),
 1552:         send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1553:         send_tty(Term, "M-l"),
 1554:         check_content(Term,["2> ",hard_unicode(),"$"]),
 1555:         check_location(Term,{0,width(hard_unicode())}),
 1556:         ok
 1557:     after
 1558:         stop_tty(Term),
 1559:         ok
 1560:     end.
 1561: 
 1562: %% We test that suspending of `erl` and then resuming restores the shell
 1563: shell_full_queue(Config) ->
 1564: 
 1565:     [throw({skip,"Need unbuffer (apt install expect) to run"}) || os:find_executable("unbuffer") =:= false],
 1566: 
 1567:     %% In order to fill the read buffer of the terminal we need to get a
 1568:     %% bit creative. We first need to start erl in bash in order to be
 1569:     %% able to get access to job control for suspended processes.
 1570:     %% We then also wrap `erl` in `unbuffer -p` so that we can suspend
 1571:     %% that program in order to block writing to stdout for a while.
 1572: 
 1573:     Name = peer:random_name(proplists:get_value(tc_path,Config)),
 1574:     os:cmd("tmux new-window -n " ++ Name ++ " -d -- bash --norc"),
 1575: 
 1576:     Peer = #{ name => Name,
 1577:               post_process_args =>
 1578:                         fun(["new-window","-n",_,"-d","--"|CmdAndArgs]) ->
 1579:                                 FlatCmdAndArgs = ["unbuffer -p "] ++
 1580:                                       lists:join(
 1581:                                         " ",[[$',A,$'] || A <- CmdAndArgs]),
 1582:                                 ["send","-t",Name,lists:flatten(FlatCmdAndArgs),"Enter"]
 1583:                         end
 1584:             },
 1585: 
 1586: 
 1587:     Term = start_tty([{peer, Peer}|Config]),
 1588:     UnbufferedPid = os:cmd("ps -o ppid= -p " ++ rpc(Term,os,getpid,[])),
 1589: 
 1590:     WriteUntilStopped =
 1591:         fun F(Char, Term) ->
 1592:                 rpc(Term,io,format,[user,[Char],[]]),
 1593:                 put(bytes,get(bytes,0)+1),
 1594:                 receive
 1595:                     stop ->
 1596:                         rpc(Term,io,format,[user,[Char+1],[]])
 1597:                 after 0 -> F(Char, Term)
 1598:                 end
 1599:         end,
 1600: 
 1601:     WaitUntilBlocked =
 1602:         fun(Pid, Ref) ->
 1603:                 (fun F(Cnt) ->
 1604:                          receive
 1605:                              {'DOWN',Ref,_,_,_} = Down ->
 1606:                                  ct:fail({io_format_did_not_block, Down})
 1607:                          after 1000 ->
 1608:                                  ok
 1609:                          end,
 1610:                          case process_info(Pid,dictionary) of
 1611:                              {dictionary,[{bytes,Cnt}]} ->
 1612:                                  ct:log("Bytes until blocked: ~p~n",[Cnt]),
 1613:                                  %% Add one extra byte as for
 1614:                                  %% the current blocking call
 1615:                                  Cnt + 1;
 1616:                              {dictionary,[{bytes,NewCnt}]} ->
 1617:                                  F(NewCnt)
 1618:                          end
 1619:                  end)(0)
 1620:         end,
 1621: 
 1622:     try
 1623:         %% First test that we can suspend and then resume
 1624:         os:cmd("kill -TSTP " ++ UnbufferedPid),
 1625:         check_content(Term,"\\Q[1]+\\E\\s*Stopped"),
 1626:         {Pid, Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> WriteUntilStopped($a, Term) end),
 1627:         WaitUntilBlocked(Pid, Ref),
 1628:         send_tty(Term, "fg"),
 1629:         send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1630:         Pid ! stop,
 1631:         check_content(Term,"b\\s+\\([^)]*\\)2>$")
 1632:     after
 1633:         stop_tty(Term),
 1634:         ok
 1635:     end,
 1636:     Name2 = peer:random_name(proplists:get_value(tc_path,Config))++"_2",
 1637:     os:cmd("tmux new-window -n " ++ Name2 ++ " -d -- bash --norc"),
 1638: 
 1639:     Peer2 = #{ name => Name2,
 1640:               post_process_args =>
 1641:                         fun(["new-window","-n",_,"-d","--"|CmdAndArgs]) ->
 1642:                                 FlatCmdAndArgs = ["unbuffer -p "] ++
 1643:                                       lists:join(
 1644:                                         " ",[[$',A,$'] || A <- CmdAndArgs]),
 1645:                                 ["send","-t",Name2,lists:flatten(FlatCmdAndArgs),"Enter"]
 1646:                         end
 1647:             },
 1648: 
 1649:     Term1 = setup_tty([{peer, Peer2},{args, ["-noshell"]}|Config]),
 1650:     UnbufferedPid1 = os:cmd("ps -o ppid= -p " ++ rpc(Term1,os,getpid,[])),
 1651:     try
 1652:         %% Then we test that all characters are written when system
 1653:         %% is terminated just after writing
 1654:         {ok,Cols} = rpc(Term1,io,columns,[user]),
 1655:         send_tty(Term1, "Enter"),
 1656:         os:cmd("kill -TSTP " ++ UnbufferedPid1),
 1657:         check_content(Term1,"\\Q[1]+\\E\\s*Stopped"),
 1658:         {Pid2, Ref2} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> WriteUntilStopped($c, Term1) end),
 1659:         Bytes = WaitUntilBlocked(Pid2, Ref2) - 1,
 1660:         stop_tty(Term1),
 1661:         send_tty(Term1, "fg"),
 1662:         send_tty(Term1, "Enter"),
 1663:         check_content(
 1664:           fun() ->
 1665:                   tmux(["capture-pane -p -S - -E - -t ",tty_name(Term1)])
 1666:           end, lists:flatten([lists:duplicate(Cols,$c) ++ "\n" ||
 1667:                                  _ <- lists:seq(1,(Bytes) div Cols)]
 1668:                              ++ [lists:duplicate((Bytes) rem Cols,$c)])),
 1669:         ct:log("~ts",[tmux(["capture-pane -p -S - -E - -t ",tty_name(Term)])]),
 1670:         ok
 1671:     after
 1672:         stop_tty(Term1),
 1673:         ok
 1674:     end.
 1675: 
 1676: get(Key,Default) ->
 1677:     case get(Key) of
 1678:         undefined ->
 1679:             Default;
 1680:         Value ->
 1681:             Value
 1682:     end.
 1683: 
 1684: %% A list of unicode graphemes that are notoriously hard to render
 1685: hard_unicode() ->
 1686:     ZWJ =
 1687:         case os:type() of
 1688:             %% macOS has very good rendering of ZWJ,
 1689:             %% but the cursor does not agree with it..
 1690:             {unix, darwin} -> [];
 1691:             _ -> [[16#1F91A,16#1F3FC]]    % Hand with skintone 🤚🏼
 1692:         end,
 1693:     [[16#1f600],             % Smilie 😀
 1694:     "한",                   % Hangul
 1695:     "Z̤͔ͧ̑̓","ä͖̭̈̇","lͮ̒ͫ","ǧ̗͚̚","o̙̔ͮ̇͐̇" %% Vertically stacked chars
 1696:      %%"👩‍👩",            % Zero width joiner
 1697:      %%"👩‍👩‍👧‍👦"                % Zero width joiner
 1698:      | ZWJ].
 1699: 
 1700: hard_unicode_match(Config) ->
 1701:     ["\\Q",[unicode_to_octet(Config, U) || U <- hard_unicode()],"\\E"].
 1702: 
 1703: unicode_to_octet(Config, U) ->
 1704:     case ?config(encoding,Config) of
 1705:         unicode -> U;
 1706:         latin1 -> unicode_to_octet(U)
 1707:     end.
 1708: 
 1709: unicode_to_octet(U) ->
 1710:     [if Byte >= 128 -> [$\\,integer_to_list(Byte,8)];
 1711:         true -> Byte
 1712:      end || <<Byte>> <= unicode:characters_to_binary(U)].
 1713: 
 1714: unicode_to_hex(Config, U) ->
 1715:     case ?config(encoding,Config) of
 1716:         unicode -> U;
 1717:         latin1 -> unicode_to_hex(U)
 1718:     end.
 1719: 
 1720: unicode_to_hex(U) when is_integer(U) ->
 1721:     unicode_to_hex([U]);
 1722: unicode_to_hex(Us) ->
 1723:     [if U < 128 -> U;
 1724:         U < 512 -> ["\\",integer_to_list(U,8)];
 1725:         true -> ["\\x{",integer_to_list(U,16),"}"]
 1726:      end || U <- Us].
 1727: 
 1728: width(C, Str) ->
 1729:     case ?config(encoding, C) of
 1730:         unicode -> width(Str);
 1731:         latin1 -> width(unicode_to_octet(Str))
 1732:     end.
 1733: width(Str) ->
 1734:     lists:sum(
 1735:       [npwcwidth(CP) || CP <- lists:flatten(Str)]).
 1736: 
 1737: npwcwidth(CP) ->
 1738:     try prim_tty:npwcwidth(CP)
 1739:     catch error:undef ->
 1740:             if CP =:= 16#D55C ->
 1741:                     2; %% 한
 1742:                CP =:= 16#1f91A ->
 1743:                     2; %% hand
 1744:                CP =:= 16#1F3Fc ->
 1745:                     2; %% Skintone
 1746:                CP =:= 16#1f600 ->
 1747:                     2; %% smilie
 1748:                true ->
 1749:                     case lists:member(CP, [775,776,780,785,786,787,788,791,793,794,
 1750:                                            804,813,848,852,854,858,871,875,878]) of
 1751:                         true ->
 1752:                             0;
 1753:                         false ->
 1754:                             1
 1755:                     end
 1756:             end
 1757:     end.
 1758: 
 1759: tmux([Cmd|_] = Command) when is_list(Cmd) ->
 1760:     tmux(lists:concat(Command));
 1761: tmux(Command) ->
 1762:     string:trim(os:cmd(["tmux ",Command])).
 1763: 
 1764: rpc(#tmux{ node = N }, Fun) ->
 1765:     erpc:call(N, Fun).
 1766: rpc(#tmux{ node = N }, M, F, A) ->
 1767:     erpc:call(N, M, F, A).
 1768: 
 1769: %% Setup a TTY, but do not type anything in terminal
 1770: setup_tty(Config) ->
 1771:     Name = maps:get(name,proplists:get_value(peer, Config, #{}),
 1772:                     peer:random_name(proplists:get_value(tc_path, Config))),
 1773: 
 1774:     Envs = lists:flatmap(fun({Key,Value}) ->
 1775:                                  ["-env",Key,Value]
 1776:                          end, proplists:get_value(env,Config,[])),
 1777: 
 1778:     ExtraArgs = proplists:get_value(args,Config,[]),
 1779: 
 1780:     ExecArgs = case os:getenv("TMUX_DEBUG") of
 1781:                    "strace" ->
 1782:                        STraceLog = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1783:                                                  Name++".strace"),
 1784:                        ct:log("Link to strace: file://~ts", [STraceLog]),
 1785:                        [os:find_executable("strace"),"-f",
 1786:                         "-o",STraceLog,
 1787:                         "-e","trace=all",
 1788:                         "-e","read=0,1,2",
 1789:                         "-e","write=0,1,2"
 1790:                        ] ++ string:split(ct:get_progname()," ",all);
 1791:                    "rr" ->
 1792:                        [os:find_executable("cerl"),"-rr"];
 1793:                    _ ->
 1794:                        string:split(ct:get_progname()," ",all)
 1795:                end,
 1796:     DefaultPeerArgs = #{ name => Name,
 1797:                          exec =>
 1798:                              {os:find_executable("tmux"),
 1799:                               ["new-window","-n",Name,"-d","--"] ++ ExecArgs },
 1800: 
 1801:                          args => ["-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1802:                                   "-connect_all","false",
 1803: %                                  "-kernel","logger_level","all",
 1804:                                   "-kernel","shell_history","disabled",
 1805:                                   "-kernel","prevent_overlapping_partitions","false",
 1806:                                   "-eval","shell:prompt_func({interactive_shell_SUITE,prompt})."
 1807:                                  ] ++ Envs ++ ExtraArgs,
 1808:                          wait_boot => 60_000,
 1809:                          detached => false
 1810:                        },
 1811: 
 1812:     {ok, Peer, Node} =
 1813:         ?CT_PEER(maps:merge(proplists:get_value(peer,Config,#{}),
 1814:                             DefaultPeerArgs)),
 1815: 
 1816:     Self = self(),
 1817: 
 1818:     %% By default peer links with the starter. For these TCs we however only
 1819:     %% want the peer to die if we die, so we create a "unidirection link" using
 1820:     %% monitors.
 1821:     spawn(fun() ->
 1822:                   TCRef = erlang:monitor(process, Self),
 1823:                   PeerRef = erlang:monitor(process, Peer),
 1824:                   receive
 1825:                       {'DOWN',TCRef,_,_,Reason} ->
 1826:                           exit(Peer, Reason);
 1827:                       {'DOWN',PeerRef,_,_,_} ->
 1828:                           ok
 1829:                   end
 1830:           end),
 1831:     unlink(Peer),
 1832: 
 1833:     "" = tmux(["set-option -t ",Name," remain-on-exit on"]),
 1834: 
 1835:     %% We start tracing on the remote node in order to help debugging
 1836:     TraceLog = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),Name++".trace"),
 1837:     ct:log("Link to trace: file://~ts",[TraceLog]),
 1838: 
 1839:     spawn(Node,
 1840:           fun() ->
 1841:                   {ok, _} = dbg:tracer(file,TraceLog),
 1842:                   %% dbg:p(whereis(user_drv),[c,m]),
 1843:                   %% dbg:p(whereis(user_drv_writer),[c,m]),
 1844:                   %% dbg:p(whereis(user_drv_reader),[c,m]),
 1845:                   %% dbg:tp(user_drv,x),
 1846:                   %% dbg:tp(prim_tty,x),
 1847:                   %% dbg:tpl(prim_tty,write_nif,x),
 1848:                   %% dbg:tpl(prim_tty,read_nif,x),
 1849:                   monitor(process, Self),
 1850:                   receive _ -> ok end
 1851:           end),
 1852: 
 1853:     #tmux{ peer = Peer, node = Node, name = Name }.
 1854: 
 1855: %% Start a tty, setup custom prompt and set cursor at bottom
 1856: start_tty(Config) ->
 1857: 
 1858:     Term = setup_tty(Config),
 1859: 
 1860:     Prompt = fun() -> ["\e[94m",54620,44397,50612,47,51312,49440,47568,"\e[0m"] end,
 1861:     erpc:call(Term#tmux.node, application, set_env,
 1862:               [stdlib, shell_prompt_func_test,
 1863:                proplists:get_value(shell_prompt_func_test, Config, Prompt)]),
 1864: 
 1865:     {Rows, _} = get_window_size(Term),
 1866: 
 1867:     %% We send a lot of newlines here in order for the number of rows
 1868:     %% in the window to be max so that we can predict what the cursor
 1869:     %% position is.
 1870:     [send_tty(Term,"\n") || _ <- lists:seq(1, Rows)],
 1871: 
 1872:     %% We enter an 'a' here so that we can get the correct orig position
 1873:     %% with an alternative prompt.
 1874:     send_tty(Term,"a.\n"),
 1875:     check_content(Term,"2>$"),
 1876:     OrigLocation = get_location(Term),
 1877:     Term#tmux{ orig_location = OrigLocation }.
 1878: 
 1879: prompt(L) ->
 1880:     N = proplists:get_value(history, L, 0),
 1881:     Fun = application:get_env(stdlib, shell_prompt_func_test,
 1882:                               fun() -> atom_to_list(node()) end),
 1883:     io_lib:format("(~ts)~w> ",[Fun(),N]).
 1884: 
 1885: stop_tty(Term) ->
 1886:     catch peer:stop(Term#tmux.peer),
 1887:     ct:log("~ts",[get_content(Term, "-e")]),
 1888: %    "" = tmux("kill-window -t " ++ Term#tmux.name),
 1889:     ok.
 1890: 
 1891: tty_name(Term) ->
 1892:     Term#tmux.name.
 1893: 
 1894: send_tty(Term, "Home") ->
 1895:     %% https://stackoverflow.com/a/55616731
 1896:     send_tty(Term,"Escape"),
 1897:     send_tty(Term,"OH");
 1898: send_tty(Term, "End") ->
 1899:     send_tty(Term,"Escape"),
 1900:     send_tty(Term,"OF");
 1901: send_tty(#tmux{ name = Name } = _Term,Value) ->
 1902:     [Head | Quotes] = string:split(Value, "'", all),
 1903:     "" = tmux("send -t " ++ Name ++ " '" ++ Head ++ "'"),
 1904:     [begin
 1905:          "" = tmux("send -t " ++ Name ++ " \"'\""),
 1906:          "" = tmux("send -t " ++ Name ++ " '" ++ V ++ "'")
 1907:      end || V <- Quotes].
 1908: 
 1909: %% We use send_stdin for testing of things that we cannot sent via
 1910: %% the tmux send command, such as invalid unicode
 1911: send_stdin(Term, Chars) when is_binary(Chars) ->
