 1912:     rpc(Term,erlang,display_string,[stdin,Chars]);
 1913: send_stdin(Term, Chars) ->
 1914:     send_stdin(Term, iolist_to_binary(unicode:characters_to_binary(Chars))).
 1915: 
 1916: check_location(Term, Where) ->
 1917:     check_location(Term, Where, 5).
 1918: check_location(Term, Where, Attempt) when is_tuple(Where) ->
 1919:     check_location(Term, [Where], Attempt);
 1920: check_location(#tmux{ orig_location = {OrigRow, OrigCol} = Orig } = Term,
 1921:                Where, Attempt) ->
 1922:     NewLocation = get_location(Term),
 1923:     case lists:any(fun({AdjRow, AdjCol}) ->
 1924:                            {OrigRow+AdjRow,OrigCol+AdjCol} =:= NewLocation
 1925:                    end, Where) of
 1926:         true -> NewLocation;
 1927:         false when Attempt =:= 0 ->
 1928:             {NewRow, NewCol} = NewLocation,
 1929:             ct:fail({wrong_location, {expected,Where},
 1930:                      {got,{NewRow - OrigRow, NewCol - OrigCol},
 1931:                       {NewLocation, Orig}}});
 1932:         false ->
 1933:             timer:sleep(50),
 1934:             check_location(Term, Where, Attempt -1)
 1935:     end.
 1936: 
 1937: get_location(Term) ->
 1938:     RowAndCol = tmux("display -pF '#{cursor_y} #{cursor_x}' -t "++Term#tmux.name),
 1939:     [Row, Col] = string:lexemes(string:trim(RowAndCol,both)," "),
 1940:     {list_to_integer(Row), list_to_integer(Col)}.
 1941: 
 1942: get_window_size(Term) ->
 1943:     RowAndCol = tmux("display -pF '#{window_height} #{window_width}' -t "++Term#tmux.name),
 1944:     [Row, Col] = string:lexemes(string:trim(RowAndCol,both)," "),
 1945:     {list_to_integer(Row), list_to_integer(Col)}.
 1946: 
 1947: check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch) ->
 1948:     check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch, #{}, 5).
 1949: check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch, Opts, Attempt) ->
 1950:     Opts = #{},
 1951:     OrigContent = case Term of
 1952:         #tmux{} -> get_content(Term);
 1953:         Fun when is_function(Fun,0) -> Fun()
 1954:     end,
 1955:     Content = case maps:find(replace, Opts) of
 1956:                 {ok, {RE,Repl} } ->
 1957:                     re:replace(OrigContent, RE, Repl, [global]);
 1958:                 error ->
 1959:                     OrigContent
 1960:                 end,
 1961:     case re:run(string:trim(Content, both), lists:flatten(NegativeMatch), [unicode]) of
 1962:         {match,_} ->
 1963:             io:format("Failed, found '~ts' in ~n'~ts'~n",
 1964:             [unicode:characters_to_binary(NegativeMatch), Content]),
 1965:             io:format("Failed, found '~w' in ~n'~w'~n",
 1966:                         [unicode:characters_to_binary(NegativeMatch), Content]),
 1967:             ct:fail(match);
 1968:         _ when Attempt =:= 0 ->
 1969:             ok;
 1970:         _ ->
 1971:             timer:sleep(500),
 1972:             check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch, Opts, Attempt - 1)
 1973:     end.
 1974: check_content(Term, Match) ->
 1975:     check_content(Term, Match, #{}).
 1976: check_content(Term, Match, Opts) when is_map(Opts) ->
 1977:     check_content(Term, Match, Opts, 5).
 1978: check_content(Term, Match, Opts, Attempt) ->
 1979:     OrigContent = case Term of
 1980:                   #tmux{} -> get_content(Term);
 1981:                   Fun when is_function(Fun,0) -> Fun()
 1982:               end,
 1983:     Content = case maps:find(replace, Opts) of
 1984:                   {ok, {RE,Repl} } ->
 1985:                       re:replace(OrigContent, RE, Repl, [global]);
 1986:                   error ->
 1987:                       OrigContent
 1988:               end,
 1989:     case re:run(string:trim(Content, both), lists:flatten(Match), [unicode]) of
 1990:         {match,_} ->
 1991:             ok;
 1992:         _ when Attempt =:= 0 ->
 1993:             io:format("Failed to find '~ts' in ~n'~ts'~n",
 1994:                       [unicode:characters_to_binary(Match), Content]),
 1995:             io:format("Failed to find '~w' in ~n'~w'~n",
 1996:                       [unicode:characters_to_binary(Match), Content]),
 1997:             ct:fail(nomatch);
 1998:         _ ->
 1999:             timer:sleep(500),
 2000:             check_content(Term, Match, Opts, Attempt - 1)
 2001:     end.
 2002: 
 2003: get_content(Term) ->
 2004:     get_content(Term, "").
 2005: get_content(#tmux{ name = Name }, Args) ->
 2006:     Content = unicode:characters_to_binary(tmux("capture-pane -p " ++ Args ++ " -t " ++ Name)),
 2007:     case string:split(Content,"a.\na") of
 2008:         [_Ignore,C] ->
 2009:             C;
 2010:         [C] ->
 2011:             C
 2012:     end.
 2013: 
 2014: %% Tests that exit of initial shell restarts shell.
 2015: exit_initial(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2016:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2017: 	old ->
 2018:             test_exit_initial(old);
 2019:         new ->
 2020:             test_exit_initial(old),
 2021:             test_exit_initial(new)
 2022:     end,
 2023:     ok.
 2024: 
 2025: test_exit_initial(old) ->
 2026:     rtnode:run(
 2027:       [{putline, ""},
 2028:        {putline, "2."},
 2029:        {expect, "2\r\n"},
 2030:        {putline, "exit()."},
 2031:        {expect, "Eshell"},
 2032:        {putline, ""},
 2033:        {putline, "35."},
 2034:        {expect, "35\r\n"}],
 2035:       [], [], ["-oldshell"]);
 2036: test_exit_initial(new) ->
 2037:     rtnode:run(
 2038:       [{putline, ""},
 2039:        {expect, "1> $"},
 2040:        {putline, "2."},
 2041:        {expect, "2"},
 2042:        {putline,"exit()."},
 2043:        {expect, "Eshell"},
 2044:        {expect, "1> $"},
 2045:        {putline, "35."},
 2046:        {expect, "35\r\n"}]).
 2047: 
 2048: stop_during_init(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2049:     {RunErl,_ToErl,[Erl|ErlArgs]} = rtnode:get_progs(),
 2050:     case rtnode:create_tempdir() of
 2051:         {error, Reason} ->
 2052:             {skip, Reason};
 2053:         Tempdir ->
 2054:             XArg = " -kernel shell_history enabled -s init stop",
 2055:             rtnode:start_runerl_command(RunErl, Tempdir, "\\\""++Erl++"\\\""++ErlArgs++XArg),
 2056:             Logs = rtnode:read_logs(Tempdir),
 2057:             rtnode:dump_logs(Logs),
 2058:             nomatch = binary:match(map_get("erlang.log.1", Logs),
 2059:                                    <<"*** ERROR: Shell process terminated! ***">>),
 2060:             ok
 2061:     end.
 2062: 
 2063: %% This testcase tests that the correct wrapping characters are added
 2064: %% When a terminal has the xn flag set, it means that wrapping may not
 2065: %% work as expected and historically the ttysl driver has always inserted
 2066: %% a " \b" (i.e. space + backspace) when an output string ends on that line
 2067: %% in order for the cursor to be at col 0 on the next line instead of col max
 2068: %% on the current line.
 2069: %%
 2070: %% This caused problems when a string was `columns` long and then ended in "\r\n"
 2071: %% as it would first wrap due to " \b" and then output "\r\n" that cause a double
 2072: %% newline to happen.
 2073: %%
 2074: %% This testcase tests that we get a " \b" when we should and we get a "\r\n" when
 2075: %% we should.
 2076: wrap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2077:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2078:         new ->
 2079:             As = lists:duplicate(20,"a"),
 2080:             rtnode:run(
 2081:               [{putline, "io:columns()."},
 2082:                {expect, "{ok,20}\r\n"},
 2083:                {putline, ["io:format(\"~s\",[lists:duplicate(20,\"a\")])."]},
 2084:                {expect, As ++ " \b"},
 2085:                {putline, ["io:format(\"~s~n~s\",[lists:duplicate(20,\"a\"),lists:duplicate(20,\"a\")])."]},
 2086:                {expect, As ++ "\r\n" ++ As ++ " \b"}
 2087:               ],
 2088:               [],
 2089:               "stty rows 40; stty columns 20; ");
 2090:         _ ->
 2091:             ok
 2092:     end,
 2093:     ok.
 2094: 
 2095: noshell_raw(Config) ->
 2096: 
 2097:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2098:         new ->
 2099: 
 2100:             TCGl = group_leader(),
 2101:             TC = self(),
 2102: 
 2103:             TestcaseFun = fun() ->
 2104:                                   link(TC),
 2105:                                   group_leader(whereis(user), self()),
 2106: 
 2107:                                   try
 2108:                                     %% Make sure we are in unicode encoding
 2109:                                     unicode = proplists:get_value(encoding, io:getopts()),
 2110: 
 2111:                                     "\fhello\n" = io:get_line("1> "),
 2112:                                     ok = shell:start_interactive({noshell, raw}),
 2113: 
 2114:                                     %% Test that we can receive 1 char when N is 100
 2115:                                     [$\^p] = io:get_chars("2> ", 100),
 2116: 
 2117:                                     %% Test that we only receive 1 char when N is 1
 2118:                                     "a" = io:get_chars("3> ", 1),
 2119:                                     "bc" = io:get_chars("", 2),
 2120: 
 2121:                                     %% Test that get_chars counts characters not bytes
 2122:                                     ok = io:setopts([binary]),
 2123:                                     ~b"å" = io:get_chars("4> ", 1),
 2124:                                     ~b"äö" = io:get_chars("", 2),
 2125: 
 2126:                                     %% Test that echo works
 2127:                                     ok = io:setopts([{echo, true}]),
 2128:                                     ~b"åäö" = io:get_chars("5> ", 100),
 2129:                                     ok = io:setopts([{echo, false}]),
 2130: 
 2131:                                     %% Test that get_line works
 2132:                                     ~b"a\n" = io:get_line("6> "),
 2133: 
 2134:                                     %% Test that get_until works
 2135:                                     ~b"a,b,c" = io:request({get_until, unicode, "7> ", ?MODULE, get_until, []}),
 2136: 
 2137:                                     %% Test that we can go back to cooked mode
 2138:                                     ok = shell:start_interactive({noshell, cooked}),
 2139:                                     ~b"abc" = io:get_chars(user, "8> ", 3),
 2140:                                     ~b"\n" = io:get_chars(user, "", 1),
 2141: 
 2142:                                     io:format("exit")
 2143:                                   catch E:R:ST ->
 2144:                                     io:format(TCGl, "~p", [{E, R, ST}])
 2145:                                   end
 2146:                           end,
 2147: 
 2148:             rtnode:run(
 2149:               [
 2150:                {eval, fun() -> spawn(TestcaseFun), ok end},
 2151: 
 2152:                {expect, "1> $"},
 2153:                {putline, "hello"},
 2154: 
 2155:                {expect, "2> $"},
 2156:                {putdata, [$\^p]},
 2157: 
 2158:                {expect, "3> $"},
 2159:                {putdata, "abc"},
 2160: 
 2161:                {expect, "4> $"},
 2162:                {putdata, ~b"åäö"},
 2163: 
 2164:                {expect, "5> $"},
 2165:                {putdata, ~b"åäö"},
 2166:                {expect, "åäö$"},
 2167: 
 2168:                {expect, "6> $"},
 2169:                {putdata, "a\r"}, %% When in raw mode, \r is newline.
 2170: 
 2171:                {expect, "7> $"},
 2172:                {putline, "a"},
 2173:                {sleep, 10},
 2174:                {putline, "b"},
 2175:                {sleep, 10},
 2176:                {putdata, "c."},
 2177: 
 2178:                {expect, "8> $"},
 2179:                {putline, "abc"},
 2180:                {expect, "abc\r\n$"},
 2181: 
 2182:                {expect, "exit$"}
 2183:               ], [], [],
 2184:               ["-noshell","-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]);
 2185:         _ -> ok
 2186:     end,
 2187:     ok.
 2188: 
 2189: get_until(start, NewChars) ->
 2190:     get_until([], NewChars);
 2191: get_until(State, NewChars) ->
 2192:     Chars = State ++ NewChars,
 2193:     case string:split(Chars, ".") of
 2194:         [Chars] -> {more, Chars ++ ","};
 2195:         [Before, After] -> {done, [C || C <- Before, C =/= $\n], After}
 2196:     end.
 2197: 
 2198: 
 2199: %% This testcase tests that shell_history works as it should.
 2200: %% We use Ctrl + P = Cp=[$\^p] in order to navigate up
 2201: %% We use Ctrl + N = Cp=[$\^n] in order to navigate down
 2202: %% We use Ctrl + B = Cp=[$\^b] in order to navigate left
 2203: %% in the console. We also need to sleep for a while in order
 2204: %% for the system to update the display before we enter more
 2205: %% commands.
 2206: shell_history(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2207:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "basic"),
 2208:     rtnode:run(
 2209:       [{putline, "echo1."},
 2210:        {expect, "echo1\r\n"},
 2211:        {putline, "echo2."},
 2212:        {expect, "echo2\r\n"},
 2213:        {putline, "echo3."},
 2214:        {expect, "echo3\r\n"},
 2215:        {putline, "echo4."},
 2216:        {expect, "echo4\r\n"},
 2217:        {putline, "echo5."},
 2218:        {expect, "echo5\r\n"}
 2219:       ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2220:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 2221:     rtnode:run(
 2222:       [{sleep,100},
 2223:        {putline, ""},
 2224:        %% the init:stop that stopped the node is dropped
 2225:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo5[.]$"},
 2226:        {putdata, [$\n]},
 2227:        {expect, "echo5\r\n"},
 2228:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo5[.]$"},
 2229:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo4[.]$"},
 2230:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo3[.]$"},
 2231:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo2[.]$"},
 2232:        {putdata, [$\^n]}, {expect, "echo3[.]$"},
 2233:        {putdata, [$\^n]}, {expect, "echo4[.]$"},
 2234:        {putdata, [$\^b]}, {sleep,50}, %% the echo4. (cursor moved one left)
 2235:        {putline, ["ECHO"]},
 2236:        {expect, "echo4ECHO\r\n"}
 2237:       ], [], [],
 2238:       mk_history_param(Path)),
 2239:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 2240: 
 2241:     %% ignore input given after io:get_line, and after h(module) pager
 2242:     rtnode:run(
 2243:        [{putdata, "io:get_line(\"getline>\").\n"},
 2244:         {expect, "getline>"},
 2245:         {putline, "hej"}, {expect, "hej\r\n"},
 2246:         {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "\\Qio:get_line(\"getline>\")\\E[.]$"}
 2247:        ], [], [],
 2248:        mk_history_param(Path)),
 2249:     ok.
 2250: 
 2251: shell_history_resize(Config) ->
 2252:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "resize"),
 2253:     rtnode:run(
 2254:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2255:        {expect, "echo\r\n"},
 2256:        {putline, "echo2."},
 2257:        {expect, "echo2\r\n"}
 2258:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history_file_bytes","123456"] ++
 2259:           mk_history_param(Path)),
 2260: 
 2261:     {ok, Logs} =
 2262:         rtnode:run(
 2263:           [{sleep,100},
 2264:            {putline, ""},
 2265:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo2[.]$$"},
 2266:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2267:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2268:            {expect, "echo"}
 2269:           ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history_file_bytes","654321"] ++
 2270:               mk_history_param(Path)),
 2271: 
 2272:     rtnode:check_logs(
 2273:       "erlang.log.1",
 2274:       "The configured log history file size is different from the size "
 2275:       "of the log file on disk", Logs),
 2276: 
 2277:     ok.
 2278: 
 2279: shell_history_eaccess(Config) ->
 2280:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "eaccess"),
 2281:     file:make_dir(filename:dirname(Path)),
 2282:     ok = file:make_dir(Path),
 2283:     {ok, Info} = file:read_file_info(Path),
 2284:     try
 2285:         NoExecMode = Info#file_info.mode band (bnot 8#111),
 2286:         file:write_file_info(Path,Info#file_info{ mode = NoExecMode }),
 2287: 
 2288:         %% Cannot create history log in folder
 2289:         {ok, Logs1} =
 2290:             rtnode:run(
 2291:               [{putline, "echo."},
 2292:                {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2293:               ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2294: 
 2295:         ct:log("~p",[Logs1]),
 2296:         rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1", "Error handling file", Logs1),
 2297: 
 2298:         %% shell_docs recursively creates the folder to store the
 2299:         %% logs. This test checks that erlang still starts if we
 2300:         %% cannot create the folders to the path.
 2301:         {ok, Logs2} =
 2302:             rtnode:run(
 2303:               [{putline, "echo."},
 2304:                {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2305:               ], [], [], mk_history_param(filename:join(Path,"logs"))),
 2306: 
 2307:         rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1", "Error handling file", Logs2)
 2308: 
 2309:     after
 2310:         file:write_file_info(Path, Info)
 2311:     end,
 2312:     ok.
 2313: 
 2314: shell_history_repair(Config) ->
 2315:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "repair"),
 2316: 
 2317:     %% We stop a node without closing the log
 2318:     shell_history_halt(Path),
 2319: 
 2320:     {ok, Logs} =
 2321:         rtnode:run(
 2322:           [{putline, ""},
 2323:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2324:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2325:            {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2326:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2327: 
 2328:     %% The regexp below checks that he string is NOT part of the log
 2329:     rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1",
 2330:                       "The shell history log file was corrupted and was repaired",
 2331:                       false,
 2332:                       Logs),
 2333:     ok.
 2334: 
 2335: shell_history_repair_corrupt(Config) ->
 2336:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "repair_corrupt"),
 2337: 
 2338:     %% We stop a node without closing the log
 2339:     shell_history_halt(Path),
 2340: 
 2341:     %% We corrupt the disklog
 2342:     {ok, D} = file:open(filename:join(Path,"erlang-shell-log.1"), [read,append]),
 2343:     ok = file:write(D, [10,10]),
 2344:     ok = file:close(D),
 2345: 
 2346:     {ok, Logs} =
 2347:         rtnode:run(
 2348:           [{putline, ""},
 2349:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2350:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2351:            {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2352:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2353: 
 2354:     rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1",
 2355:                       "The shell history log file was corrupted and was repaired.",
 2356:                       Logs),
 2357:     ok.
 2358: 
 2359: shell_history_corrupt(Config) ->
 2360:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "corrupt"),
 2361: 
 2362:     %% We initialize the shell history log with a known value.
 2363:     rtnode:run(
 2364:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2365:        {expect, "echo\r\n"},
 2366:        {putline, "echo2."},
 2367:        {expect, "echo2\r\n"}
 2368:       ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2369: 
 2370:     %% We corrupt the disklog.
 2371:     {ok, D} = file:open(filename:join(Path,"erlang-shell-log.1"), [read, append]),
 2372:     ok = file:write(D, [10, 10]),
 2373:     ok = file:close(D),
 2374: 
 2375:     {ok, Logs} =
 2376:         rtnode:run(
 2377:           [{putline, ""},
 2378:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo2[.]$"},
 2379:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2380:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2381:            {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2382:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2383: 
 2384:     rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1", "Invalid chunk in the file", Logs),
 2385:     ok.
 2386: 
 2387: %% Stop the node without closing the log.
 2388: shell_history_halt(Path) ->
 2389:     try
 2390:         rtnode:run(
 2391:           [{putline, "echo."},
 2392:            {expect, "echo\r\n"},
 2393:            {sleep, 2500}, % disk_log internal cache timer is 2000 ms
 2394:            {putline, "halt(0)."},
 2395:            {expect, "\r\n"},
 2396:            {sleep, 1000} %% wait for node to terminate
 2397:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path))
 2398:     catch
 2399:         _:_ ->
 2400:             ok
 2401:     end.
 2402: 
 2403: shell_history_path(Config, TestCase) ->
 2404:     filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2405:                    "shell_history", TestCase]).
 2406: 
 2407: mk_history_param(Path) ->
 2408:     ["-kernel","shell_history","enabled",
 2409:      "-kernel","shell_history_path","\"" ++ Path ++ "\"",
 2410:      "-kernel","shell_history_drop","[\"init:stop().\"]"
 2411:     ].
 2412: 
 2413: shell_history_custom(_Config) ->
 2414:     %% Up key: Ctrl + P = Cp=[$\^p]
 2415:     rtnode:run(
 2416:       [{expect, "1> $"},
 2417:        %% {putline, ""},
 2418:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "0[.]"},
 2419:        {putdata, [$\n]},
 2420:        {expect, "0\r\n"},
 2421:        {putline, "echo."},
 2422:        {expect, "!echo\r\n"} % exclamation mark is printed by custom history module
 2423:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2424:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2425:     ok.
 2426: 
 2427: shell_history_custom_errors(_Config) ->
 2428: 
 2429:     %% Check that we can start with a node with an undefined
 2430:     %% provider module.
 2431:     rtnode:run(
 2432:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2433:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2434:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history","very_broken",
 2435:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2436: 
 2437:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2438:     %% that crashes in load/0.
 2439:     rtnode:run(
 2440:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2441:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2442:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2443:                   "-kernel","provider_load","crash",
 2444:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2445: 
 2446:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2447:     %% that return incorrect in load/0.
 2448:     rtnode:run(
 2449:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2450:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2451:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2452:                   "-kernel","provider_load","badreturn",
 2453:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2454: 
 2455:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2456:     %% that crashes in load/0.
 2457:     rtnode:run(
 2458:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2459:        {expect, "(Disabling shell history logging.|echo)"},
 2460:        {expect, "(Disabling shell history logging.|echo)"}
 2461:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2462:                   "-kernel","provider_add","crash",
 2463:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2464: 
 2465:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2466:     %% that return incorrect in load/0.
 2467:     rtnode:run(
 2468:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2469:        {expect, "It returned {error,badreturn}.\r\n"},
 2470:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2471:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2472:                   "-kernel","provider_add","badreturn",
 2473:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2474: 
 2475:     ok.
 2476: 
 2477: shell_history_toggle(_Config) ->
 2478: 
 2479:     %% Check that we can start with a node with an undefined
 2480:     %% provider module.
 2481:     rtnode:run(
 2482:       [
 2483:        {putline, "io:setopts(user, [{line_history, true}])."},
 2484:        {expect, "{error,enotsup}\r\n"},
 2485: 
 2486:        %% Test that io:get_line does not save into history buffer
 2487:        {putline, ~s'io:get_line("").'},
 2488:        {putline, ~s'hello'},
 2489:        {expect, ~s'\\Q"hello\\n"\r\n\\E'},
 2490:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, %% Up key
 2491:        {expect, ~s'\\Qio:get_line("").\\E'},
 2492:        {putdata, [$\^n]},  %% Down key
 2493:        {expect, ~s'> $'},
 2494: 
 2495:        %% Test that io:get_line does save into history buffer when enabled
 2496:        {putline, "io:setopts([{line_history, true}])."},
 2497:        {expect, "ok\r\n"},
 2498:        {putline, ~s'io:get_line("> ").'},
 2499:        {putline, ~s'hello again'},
 2500:        {expect, ~s'\\Q"hello again\\n"\r\n\\E'},
 2501:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, %% Up key
 2502:        {expect, ~s'hello again'},
 2503:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, %% Up key
 2504:        {expect, ~s'\\Qio:get_line("> ").\\E'},
 2505:        {putdata, [$\^n]},  %% Down key
 2506:        {expect, ~s'hello again'},
 2507:        {putdata, [$\^n]},  %% Down key
 2508:        {expect, ~s'> $'},
 2509: 
 2510:        %% Test that io:get_line does not save into history buffer when disabled
 2511:        {putline, "io:setopts([{line_history, false}])."},
 2512:        {putline, ~s'io:get_line("| ").'},
 2513:        {putline, ~s'hello'},
 2514:        {expect, ~s'\\Q"hello\\n"\r\n\\E'},
 2515:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, %% Up key
 2516:        {expect, ~s'\\Qio:get_line("| ").\\E'},
 2517:        {putdata, [$\^n]},  %% Down key
 2518:        {expect, ~s'> $'}
 2519:       ], [], [], ["-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2520: 
 2521:         ok.
 2522: 
 2523: load() ->
 2524:     case application:get_env(kernel,provider_load) of
 2525:         {ok, crash} ->
 2526:             error(crash);
 2527:         {ok, badreturn} ->
 2528:             %% Should return a list of string()
 2529:             ok;
 2530:         _ ->
 2531:             ["0.\n\n"]
 2532:     end.
 2533: 
 2534: add(_Line) ->
 2535:     case application:get_env(kernel,provider_add) of
 2536:         {ok, crash} ->
 2537:             error(crash);
 2538:         {ok, badreturn} ->
 2539:             %% Should return ok
 2540:             {error, badreturn};
 2541:         _ ->
 2542:             io:format("!", [])
 2543:     end.
 2544: 
 2545: %% Tests that local shell can be started by means of job control.
 2546: job_control_local(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2547:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2548: 	old ->
 2549: 	    %% Old shell tests
 2550: 	    {skip,"No new shell found"};
 2551: 	new ->
 2552: 	    %% New shell tests
 2553: 	    rtnode:run(
 2554:               [{putline, ""},
 2555:                {expect,  "1> $"},
 2556:                {putline, "2."},
 2557:                {expect,  "\r\n2\r\n"},
 2558:                {putline, "\^g"},
 2559:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2560:                {putline, "s"},
 2561:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2562:                {putline, "c"},
 2563:                {expect,  "\r\nEshell"},
 2564:                {expect,  "1> $"},
 2565:                {putline, "35."},
 2566:                {expect,  "\r\n35\r\n"},
 2567:                {expect,  "2> $"},
 2568:                {putline, "receive M -> M end.\r\n"},
 2569:                {sleep, 6000},
 2570:                {expect, "Command is taking a long time"},
 2571:                {putline, "\^g"},
 2572:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2573:                {putline, "i 3"},
 2574:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2575:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2576:                {putline, "i 2"},
 2577:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2578:                {putline, "c"},
 2579:                {expect,  "[*][*] exception exit: killed"},
 2580:                {expect,  "[23]>"},
 2581:                {putline, "\^g"},
 2582:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2583:                {putline, "k 3"},
 2584:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2585:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2586:                {putline, "k 2"},
 2587:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2588:                {putline, "k"},
 2589:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2590:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2591:                {putline, "c"},
 2592:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2593:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2594:                {putline, "i"},
 2595:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2596:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2597:                {putline, "?"},
 2598:                {expect,  "this message"},
 2599:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2600:                {putline, "h"},
 2601:                {expect,  "this message"},
 2602:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2603:                {putdata, "\t"}, %% Test that we don't crash
 2604:                {sleep, 100},
 2605:                {putline, ""},
 2606:                {expect,  "^\r\n\r\n --> $"},
 2607:                {putdata, "\^r"}, %% Test that we don't crash
 2608:                {sleep, 100},
 2609:                {putline, ""},
 2610:                {expect,  "^\r\n\r\n --> $"},
 2611:                {putline, "c 1"},
 2612:                {expect, "\r\n"},
 2613:                {putline, "35."},
 2614:                {expect, "\r\n35\r\n"},
 2615:                {expect, "[23]> $"}
 2616:               ]),
 2617:             ok
 2618:     end.
 2619: 
 2620: %% Tests that remote shell can be started by means of job control.
 2621: job_control_remote(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2622:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2623: 	old ->
 2624: 	    {skip,"No new shell found"};
 2625: 	_ ->
 2626:             {ok, Peer, NSNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{ args => ["-connect_all","false"],
 2627:                                              peer_down => continue }),
 2628:             try
 2629:                 test_remote_job_control(NSNode)
 2630:             after
 2631:                 peer:stop(Peer)
 2632:             end
 2633:     end.
 2634: 
 2635: %% Tests that remote shell can be started by means of job control to
 2636: %% -noshell node.
 2637: job_control_remote_noshell(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2638:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2639: 	old ->
 2640: 	    {skip,"No new shell found"};
 2641: 	_ ->
 2642: 	    {ok, Peer, NSNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{ name => peer:random_name(test_remote_job_control),
 2643:                                              args => ["-connect_all","false","-noshell"],
 2644:                                              peer_down => continue }),
 2645:             try
 2646:                 test_remote_job_control(NSNode)
 2647:             after
 2648:                 peer:stop(Peer)
 2649:             end
 2650:     end.
 2651: 
 2652: test_remote_job_control(Node) ->
 2653:     RemNode = peer:random_name(test_remote_job_control),
 2654:     Pid = spawn_link(Node, fun() ->
 2655:                                    receive die ->
 2656:                                            ok
 2657:                                    end
 2658:                            end),
 2659:     PidStr = erpc:call(Node, erlang, pid_to_list, [Pid]),
 2660:     true = erpc:call(Node, erlang, register, [kalaskula,Pid]),
 2661:     PrintedNode = printed_atom(Node),
 2662:     CookieString = printed_atom(erlang:get_cookie()),
 2663: 
 2664:     rtnode:run(
 2665:       [{putline, ""},
 2666:        {putline, "erlang:get_cookie()."},
 2667:        {expect, "\r\n\\Q" ++ CookieString ++ "\\E"},
 2668:        {putdata, "\^g"},
 2669:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2670:        {putline, "r " ++ PrintedNode},
 2671:        {expect, "\r\n"},
 2672:        {putline, "j"},
 2673:        {expect, "1  {shell,start,\\[init]}"},
 2674:        {expect, "2[*] {\\Q"++PrintedNode++"\\E,shell,start,\\[]}"},
 2675:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2676:        {putline, "c"},
 2677:        {expect, "\r\n"},
 2678:        {expect, "Eshell"},
 2679:        {expect, "\\Q(" ++ atom_to_list(Node) ++")1> \\E$"},
 2680:        {putline, "whereis(kalaskula)."},
 2681:        {expect, PidStr},
 2682:        {putline, "kalaskula ! die."},
 2683:        {putline, "exit()."},
 2684:        {expect, "[*][*][*] Shell process terminated!"},
 2685:        {putdata, "\^g"},
 2686:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2687:        {putline, "j"},
 2688:        {expect, "1  {shell,start,\\[init]}"},
 2689:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2690:        {putline, "c"},
 2691:        {expect, "Unknown job"},
 2692:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2693:        {putline, "c 1"},
 2694:        {expect, "\\Q("++RemNode++"@\\E[^)]*\\)[12]> $"},
 2695:        {putdata, "\^g"},
 2696:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2697:        {putline, "j"},
 2698:        {expect, "1[*] {shell,start,\\[init]}"},
 2699:        {putline, "c"},
 2700:        {expect, "\\Q("++RemNode++"@\\E[^)]*\\)[123]> $"},
 2701:        {sleep, 100},
 2702:        {putline, "35."},
 2703:        {expect, "\\Q("++RemNode++"@\\E[^)]*\\)[123]> $"}
 2704:       ], RemNode),
 2705:     Pid ! die,
 2706:     ok.
 2707: 
 2708: %% Tests various control keys.
 2709: ctrl_keys(_Config) ->
 2710:     Cu = [$\^u],
 2711:     Cw = [$\^w],
 2712:     Cy = [$\^y],
 2713:     Home = [27,$O,$H],
 2714:     End = [27,$O,$F],
 2715:     rtnode:run(
 2716:       [{putline,""},
 2717:        {putline,"2."},
 2718:        {expect,"2"},
 2719:        {putline,"\"hello "++Cw++"world\"."},	% test <CTRL>+W
 2720:        {expect,"\"world\""},
 2721:        {putline,"\"hello "++Cu++"\"world\"."},	% test <CTRL>+U
 2722:        {expect,"\"world\""},
 2723:        {putline,"world\"."++Home++"\"hello "},	% test <HOME>
 2724:        {expect,"\"hello world\""},
 2725:        {putline,"world"++Home++"\"hello "++End++"\"."},	% test <END>
 2726:        {expect,"\"hello world\""},
 2727:        {putline,"\"hello world\""++Cu++Cy++"."},
 2728:        {expect,"\"hello world\""}] ++
 2729:           wordLeft() ++ wordRight()),
 2730:     ok.
 2731: 
 2732: wordLeft() ->
 2733:     L1 = "\e\e[D",
 2734:     L2 = "\e[5D",
 2735:     L3 = "\e[1;5D",
 2736:     wordLeft(L1) ++ wordLeft(L2) ++ wordLeft(L3).
 2737: 
 2738: wordLeft(Chars) ->
 2739:     End = "\eOF",
 2740:     [{putline,"\"world\""++Chars++"hello "++End++"."},
 2741:      {expect,"\"hello world\""}].
 2742: 
 2743: wordRight() ->
 2744:     R1 = "\e\e[C",
 2745:     R2 = "\e[5C",
 2746:     R3 = "\e[1;5C",
 2747:     wordRight(R1) ++ wordRight(R2) ++ wordRight(R3).
 2748: 
 2749: wordRight(Chars) ->
 2750:     Home = "\eOH",
 2751:     [{putline,"world"++Home++"\"hello "++Chars++"\"."},
 2752:      {expect,"\"hello world\""}].
 2753: 
 2754: %% Test that -remsh works
 2755: remsh_basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2756:     {ok, Peer, TargetNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
 2757:     TargetNodeStr = printed_atom(TargetNode),
 2758:     [_Name,Host] = string:split(atom_to_list(node()), "@"),
 2759: 
 2760:     PreCmds = [{putline,""},
 2761:                {putline,"node()."},
 2762:                {expect, "\\Q" ++ TargetNodeStr ++ "\\E\r\n"}],
 2763: 
 2764:     PostCmds = quit_hosting_node(),
 2765: 
 2766:     %% Test that remsh works with explicit -sname.
 2767:     HostNode = atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ "_host",
 2768:     HostNodeStr = printed_atom(list_to_atom(HostNode ++ "@" ++ Host)),
 2769:     rtnode:run(
 2770:       PreCmds ++
 2771:           [{putline,"nodes()."},
 2772:            {expect, "\\Q" ++ HostNodeStr ++ "\\E"}] ++
 2773:           PostCmds,
 2774:       HostNode, " ", "-remsh " ++ TargetNodeStr),
 2775: 
 2776:     %% Test that remsh works without -sname.
 2777:     rtnode:run(PreCmds ++ PostCmds, [], " ", "-remsh " ++ TargetNodeStr),
 2778: 
 2779:     %% Test that if multiple remsh are given, we select the first
 2780:     rtnode:run([{expect, "Multiple"}] ++ PreCmds ++ PostCmds,
 2781:                [], " ",
 2782:                "-remsh " ++ TargetNodeStr ++ " -remsh invalid_node"),
 2783: 
 2784:     peer:stop(Peer),
 2785: 
 2786:     ok.
 2787: 
 2788: %% Test that if we cannot connect to a node, we get a correct error
 2789: remsh_error(_Config) ->
 2790:     "Could not connect to \"invalid_node\"\n" =
 2791:         os:cmd(ct:get_progname() ++ " -remsh invalid_node").
 2792: 
 2793: quit_hosting_node() ->
 2794:     %% Command sequence for entering a shell on the hosting node.
 2795:     [{putdata, "\^g"},
 2796:      {expect, "--> $"},
 2797:      {putline, "s"},
 2798:      {expect, "--> $"},
 2799:      {putline, "c"},
 2800:      {expect, ["Eshell"]},
 2801:      {expect, ["1> $"]}].
 2802: 
 2803: %% Test that -remsh works with long names.
 2804: remsh_longnames(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2805:     %% If we cannot resolve the domain, we need to add localhost to the longname
 2806:     Domain =
 2807:         case inet_db:res_option(domain) of
 2808:             [] ->
 2809:                 "@127.0.0.1";
 2810:             _ -> ""
 2811:         end,
 2812:     Name = peer:random_name(?FUNCTION_NAME),
 2813:     case rtnode:start(" -name " ++ Name ++ Domain) of
 2814:         {ok, _SRPid, STPid, SNode, SState} ->
 2815:             try
 2816:                 {ok, _CRPid, CTPid, CNode, CState} =
 2817:                     rtnode:start("-name undefined" ++ Domain ++
 2818:                                      " -remsh " ++ Name),
 2819:                 try
 2820:                     ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2821:                            SNode,
 2822:                            STPid,
 2823:                            [{putline, ""},
 2824:                             {putline, "node()."},
 2825:                             {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"}], 1),
 2826:                     ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2827:                            CNode,
 2828:                            CTPid,
 2829:                            [{putline, ""},
 2830:                             {putline, "node()."},
 2831:                             {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"} | quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2832:                 after
 2833:                     rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(CState))
 2834:                 end
 2835:             after
 2836:                 rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(SState))
 2837:             end;
 2838:         {skip, _} = Else ->
 2839:             Else
 2840:     end.
 2841: 
 2842: %% Test that -remsh works without epmd.
 2843: remsh_no_epmd(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2844:     EPMD_ARGS = "-start_epmd false -erl_epmd_port 12346 ",
 2845:     Name = ?CT_PEER_NAME(),
 2846:     case rtnode:start([],"ERL_EPMD_PORT=12345 ",
 2847:                       EPMD_ARGS ++ " -sname " ++ Name) of
 2848:         {ok, _SRPid, STPid, SNode, SState} ->
 2849:             try
 2850:                 ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2851:                        SNode,
 2852:                        STPid,
 2853:                        [{putline, ""},
 2854:                         {putline, "node()."},
 2855:                         {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"}], 1),
 2856:                 {ok, _CRPid, CTPid, CNode, CState} =
 2857:                     rtnode:start([],"ERL_EPMD_PORT=12345 ",
 2858:                                  EPMD_ARGS ++ " -remsh "++Name),
 2859:                 try
 2860:                     ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2861:                            CNode,
 2862:                            CTPid,
 2863:                            [{putline, ""},
 2864:                             {putline, "node()."},
 2865:                             {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"} | quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2866:                 after
 2867:                     rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(CState))
 2868:                 end
 2869:             after
 2870:                 rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(SState))
 2871:             end;
 2872:         {skip, _} = Else ->
 2873:             Else
 2874:     end.
 2875: remsh_expand_compatibility_25(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2876:     {ok, _Peer, TargetNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{}), %% Create a vsn 26 node
 2877:     NodeName = atom_to_list(TargetNode), %% compatibility
 2878:     %% Start a node on vsn 25 but run the shell on vsn 26
 2879:     case rtnode:start(peer:random_name(), "stty columns 200; ERL_AFLAGS= ", "-remsh "++NodeName, [{release, "25"}|Config]) of
 2880:         {ok, _SRPid, STPid, _, SState} ->
 2881:             try
 2882:                 ok = rtnode:send_commands(undefined,
 2883:                        STPid,
 2884:                        [{putdata, "erlang:is_atom\t"},
 2885:                         {expect, "\\Qerlang:is_atom(\\E"}|
 2886:                         quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2887:             after
 2888:                 Logs = rtnode:stop(SState),
 2889:                 rtnode:dump_logs(Logs)
 2890:             end;
 2891:         Else when element(1, Else) =/= ok -> Else
 2892:     end.
 2893: remsh_expand_compatibility_later_version(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2894:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2895:     case ?CT_PEER_REL([], "25", PrivDir) of
 2896:         not_available -> {skip, "25 not available"};
 2897:         {ok, _Peer, TargetNode}  ->
 2898:             NodeName = atom_to_list(TargetNode),
 2899:             %% Start a node on later version but run the shell on vsn 25
 2900:             case rtnode:start(peer:random_name(), "stty columns 200; ERL_AFLAGS= ", "-remsh " ++ NodeName, Config) of
 2901:                 {ok, _SRPid, STPid, _, SState} ->
 2902:                     try
 2903:                         ok = rtnode:send_commands(undefined,
 2904:                             STPid,
 2905:                             [{putdata, "erlang:is_atom\t"},
 2906:                              {expect, "\\Qerlang:is_atom(\\E"}|
 2907:                              quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2908:                     after
 2909:                         Logs = rtnode:stop(SState),
 2910:                         rtnode:dump_logs(Logs)
 2911:                     end;
 2912:                 Else when element(1, Else) =/= ok -> Else
 2913:             end
 2914:     end.
 2915: 
 2916: printed_atom(A) ->
 2917:     lists:flatten(io_lib:format("~w", [A])).
